Rating: 0.30
Rosanna Davison explains why she shields her baby Sophia's face on social media

Rosanna Davison has opened up on her decision to shield her baby’s face from the world saying it’s not her right to show Sophia online. The 36-year old former Miss World and her husband Wes Quirke welcomed baby Sophia in November via surrogate. The couple helped couples struggling to conceive across the nation by sharing their heartfelt story on their journey to parenthood on social media. Rosanna opened up on how multiple failed attempts to conceive ended in happiness as they welcomed their miracle baby last year. The couple made the decision early on to protect baby Sophia’s identity online. Rosanna told the Irish Mirror: “We knew a long time before she was born that we wouldn’t show her face online, primarily for her safety and privacy and because we feel that it’s not our right to put her face online until she’s old enough to decide for herself. “Each to their own. But she’s super cute, so we bombard our family WhatsApp group chats with her photos and videos instead!” The model turned nutritionist said to help with the crisis she’s sharing as many immune boosting recipes on her website, but with motherhood taking over, her time is no longer her own. She said: I’m sharing tips and recipes on social media for immune-boosting foods and I regularly share my smoothie recipes. “I always think I’ll have more time for that but having a small baby is incredibly demanding on your time as any parent knows!” She advised that our lifestyle choices are of paramount importance when it comes to boosting our immunity. She said: “Our lifestyle choices, from food to sleep and physical activity, can all have a positive influence on our immune system health.” The stunner told how this month was to mark her first family holiday with baby Sophia but the pandemic put a stop to that. She explained: “We had a trip to Ibiza booked for the first half of May. “It would have been our first family holiday with Sophia and we had planned to go to a quiet family resort. “I just can’t imagine this crisis disappearing for another few months at the least. However, we’re all in this together and need to work as a team and look after each other.” Rosanna’s international work has also been cancelled she added: “ I had a work trip to Germany next week cancelled, and understandably so. “But yes, I’m so grateful to be home and safe with my little family. “I love my work trips abroad and I’m back to work with TanOrganic, a brand I adore, but it’s been lovely to spend so much time at home with Sophia since she’s been born. “Being a mum is the best job in the world!” Rosanna recommends a simple ginger cinnamon and apple porridge to boost immunity. For info see  www.rosannadavisonnutrition.com/apple-ginger-and-cinnamon-immunity-porridge/

Joe Wicks 'feeling fantastic' after operation and vows he's 'back in the game'

Joe Wicks has admitted he’s feeling ‘fantastic’ after having surgery on his hand and shared an update from his hospital bed. The Body Coach had been admitted to Kingston Hospital in London over a painful injury and underwent an operation to repair it after falling off a bike, but he’s now fighting fit and rearing to get back to keeping the globe healthy during coronavirus lockdown. ‘Good morning everybody, I feel fantastic,’ Joe said in a video posted on his Instagram Stories. ‘The antibiotics have well and truly kicked in. The inflammation and the swelling has gone right down.’ He then wiggled his fingers and joked he might now write some emails and play the guitar. ‘I’m back in the game so see you Monday morning for some nose-picking,’ Joe added. Joe revealed that he will be returning to his PE session next week, with the 33-year-old previously telling his followers: ‘See you Monday for PE with Joe.’ He also explained that his wife, Rosie, will be helping him for the upcoming session, as he might not be able to showcase many exercises due to his injury, but he ‘doesn’t want to let anyone down’. ‘I’ve just asked my lovely wife Rosie to help me with #pewithjoe on Monday morning and she’s kindly agreed,’ he said, as he posted a picture of Rosie with their son, Marley, to his story. ‘It’s well out of her comfort zone but she’s my best friend and she knows how much this means to me. ‘I don’t want to let anyone down but I don’t think I’m going to be able to demo many exercises so I’ll be having Rosie on camera with me. ‘I’ll still lead the session and coach you through it. I’ll just have Rosie demonstrating the moves.’ Got a story? If you’ve got a celebrity story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page – we’d love to hear from you.

3 May 09:43 • Metro • https://metro.co.uk/2020/05/03/joe-wicks-feels-fantastic-operation-vows-back-int-game-12647427/
Rating: 2.18
Joe Wicks reveals he's been hospitalised as he releases heartfelt message to fans

For weeks, Joe Wicks has kept the nation exercised and entertained with his live fitness classes during lockdown. The health and fitness guru has become a national treasure thanks to his dedication and positive attitude, and it's safe to say that we're all thankful for it. But things have been put on hold for a bit, with Joe revealing that he is currently in hospital awaiting surgery. The 33-year-old Body Coach took to Instagram to tell his 3.4 million followers that he had admitted himself into hospital on Friday after a previous hand injury became inflamed, The Mirror reports. Joe initially fractured his hand at the end of March after falling off his bike and has already had one operation on the injury. Despite making progress in his recovery in the last few weeks, the YouTube star said he woke up on Friday and his hand was throbbing "like liquid hot magma". He said to fans: "Great news. Bones have healed. Wires haven’t broke but the soft tissue is inflamed and possibly infected. They are operating today and removing the wires. They’ve given me some strong painkillers which have taken the edge off it." However, medical staff at Kingston Hospital were unable to take Joe into surgery immediately because other patients were waiting, so the fitness guru spent Friday night in a hospital bed ahead of the minor procedure scheduled for Saturday. Wearing a hospital gown in the majority of his social media stories, Joe was put on an IV drip to ease the pain. Later on Friday evening, Joe spoke from his hospital bed about how thankful he was for the NHS and shared a number of kind messages from well wishers. "I'm feeling super grateful for this healthcare system we've got, and there's people of all nationalities coming in here and taking care of me." In the heartfelt message, the health guru explained that he was in safe hands thanks to the incredible staff at Kingston hospital. "It doesn't matter how old you are, when you see a nurse or a doctor you instantly feel safe , calm and relaxed." In his final posts of the evening, the health and fitness coach explained that his thoughts were with the country's front line staff and healthcare workers. "Lots of love to anyone out there who are NHS staff," he added. Joe is yet to update social media followers on how today's minor procedure went.

Joe Wicks admitted to hospital and undergoing surgery after accident

Joe Wicks was due to undergo surgery today after ending up back in hospital following an accident on his bike. The Body Coach star, whose YouTube fitness sessions have attracted millions of viewers during the lockdown, initially fractured his hand in the accident back in March. He has already had one operation on the hand, but the 33-year-old admitted himself to hospital for a second time on Friday after suffering from pain and swelling, The Mirror reports. He told his followers online it felt like his hand was throbbing "like liquid hot magma". The 33-year-old, dubbed 'the Nation's PE Teacher' also posted an x-ray image of his hand which showed a number of wires. "Great news," he said online. "Bones have healed. He was also put on an IV drip, reports The Mirror. In a second post last night, Wicks paid tribute to the NHS and the staff at Kingston Hospital who have been caring for him. "It doesn't matter how old you are, when you see a nurse or a doctor you instantly feel safe , calm and relaxed. "Lots of love to anyone out there who are NHS staff."

Rating: 1.15
Joe Wicks in hospital on a drip fighting infection after hand injury

Joe Wicks, the nation's PE teacher, is in hospital on a drip fighting off an infection. The Body Coach star, who has become a lockdown hero thanks to his daily PE lessons on YouTube, is slated to have an operation today. He had previously injured his hand after falling off his bike and updated fans yesterday, saying: "Great news. Bones have healed. "Wires haven’t broken but the soft tissue is inflamed and possibly infected. They are operating today and removing the wires. They’ve given me some strong painkillers which have taken the edge off it." However, speaking from his hospital bed later, the 33-year-old told his social media followers: "They aren't able to do the operation today, they have other patients in the queue. "They are a bit slower with certain things so I'm staying tonight. "They're going to give me some nice morphine, and some antibiotics on the drip-a-roo. In the morning, hopefully first thing, I'll be having the wires taken out." He added later: "I tell you what, this infection is no joke. I've had codeine up to my eyeballs. They gave me liquid morphine, but it ain't taking the edge off it. It's throbbing." He added: "I've got a drip of liquid paracetamol. That is absolutely fantastic. Paracetamol IV saves the day for now, almost instant effect and on the pain. "So glad I'm staying here tonight. I woke up all night last night as it was throbbing and pulsating like liquid hot magma. "Thanks for all your well wishes. Gonna get a good night's sleep I think." The dad of two had minor surgery for his injured hand in March and had recently been wearing his arm in a bandage. He continued his online fitness classes, raising money for the NHS, but he hasn't been able to do push-ups. Leave us your comments on our Facebook page @EntertainmentDailyFix CoronavirusNHS

2 May 09:31 • Entertainment Daily • https://www.entertainmentdaily.co.uk/news/joe-wicks-in-hospital-on-a-drip-fighting-infection-after-hand-injury/
Rating: 0.30
Joe Wicks admitted to hospital for operation over painful hand injury

Joe Wicks has been admitted to hospital over his painful hand injury, with the Body Coach star set to undergo an operation. The YouTuber, who’s been keeping fans fit and active with his daily PE classes, fractured his hand a few weeks ago after falling off a bike. Updating viewers on his Instagram Stories, he explained: ‘Great news. Bones have healed. ‘Wires haven’t broke but the soft tissue is inflamed and possibly infected. They are operating today and removing the wires. They’ve given me some strong painkillers which have taken the edge off it’. However, he later shared a clip of himself lying in a hospital bed, explaining: ‘They aren’t able to do the operation today, they have other patients in the queue, they’re a bit slower with certain things so I’m staying tonight. They’re going to give me some nice morphine, and some antibiotics on the drip-a-roo. ‘And in the morning, hopefully first thing, I’ll be getting the wires out. I tell you what this infection is no joke, I’ve had codeine up to my eyeballs. ‘They gave me liquid morphine, it ain’t taking the edge off it. It’s throbbing,’ he added, before declaring himself: ‘Throbbington Crusoe.’ He added: ‘So glad I’m staying here tonight. I woke up all night last night as it was throbbing and pulsating like liquid hot magma. Thanks for all your well wishes. Gonna get a good night’s sleep I think.’ Nevertheless, the fitness star kept positive and thankful, adding before he went to sleep: ‘I’m just having a bit of a moment really, where I’m feeling super grateful for this healthcare system we’ve got, and these people that are coming in. ‘There’s people from all different nationalities, coming in here, taking care of me, nurturing me.’ ‘Lots of love to anyone out there that’s NHS staff in any hospital, anywhere in the country,’ he continued. Joe has been raising money for the NHS with his workout videos, donating all the ad revenue to charity. So far, he’s raised more than £91,000 as thousands around the world tune into his videos every day. ‘Thank you so much for taking part and helping raise all this money for a cause which I feel we can all be proud of,’ he told fans. ‘The great news is we can grow this number even bigger each week by coming back and tuning in again.’ Got a story? Joe Wicks gives updates on hand injury from hospital

Joe Wicks has been in hospital after injuring his hand. The Body Coach, 33, showed fans an X-ray before the procedure, saying he would be operated on because the soft tissue in his hand is “inflamed and possibly infected”. He previously told followers of his hit PE workouts that he broke a bone in his hand after falling off his bike. Wicks, who is donating the money raised from his online PE lessons to the NHS, posted a video of himself “gowned up” with “the socks on” and waiting for his operation. He later said, from his hospital bed, that the operation had been delayed. “They aren’t able to do the operation today,” the star said. “They’ve got other patients in the queue and they’re a bit slower than normal with certain things.” Wicks said the pain from the “infection” was excruciating, adding: “I woke up all night… as it was throbbing and pulsating like liquid hot magma. “Thanks for all your well-wishes. Gonna get a good night’s sleep I think.” Wicks told fans that “Paracetamol IV” had “saved the day for now, almost instant effect on the pain…. “So glad I’m staying here tonight,” he said, adding he was feeling “super grateful” for the NHS.

Phillip Schofield's extreme new style after moving out of marital home and into bachelor flat

Phillip Schofield has taken to Instagram to show off his wildly different lockdown hair choices. In one picture he showed off slick back and styled hairdoo, while in another his silver hair was sticking up and unkempt. The TV personality wore a smart polo shirt in the black and white pic of his slick look while in the other he grimaced as his mop spiked in all directions. And fans of the presenter who wrote with his snap: "Lockdown hair options" had mixed opinions about his wacky hair styles. One wrote: "The second wild look!!." Another said: "Silver fox, followed by two flame emojis." A fan wrote: "Wow Phillip! Rocking them hair styles." Another added: "I like the nutty professor look!" While other fans were not as impressed with Phillip's lockdown hair choices. One wrote: "Cut it all offfffffff." Another said: "How many likes on this comment for you to shave it all off." The This Morning host also posted his smart hair style on his Instagram stories, captioning it: "If ya can't cut it, slick it." Philtook to his Instagram earlier this week to share the same snap of is unkempt hair. In the pic Phil appeared to be sitting in a balcony area on on a plush grey sofa in his new place. The pic was taken from his new bachelor pad where he moved to after moving out of the home he shared with his wife Steph when he came out as gay earlier this year. Phillip admitted that he 'misses hugs' after moving out of the £2million family home on Monday's episode of This Morning. He also this week opened up on how This Morning going ahead amid the coronavirus lockdown allowed him to keep positive mentally. He said: "It's very good for the head isn't it. I think this has saved my head actually, being able to come in here and keep going." Later on in the show, Phillip shared important advice as he encouraged one tearful viewer to remain positive during the unusual situation of lockdown. He said: "You've got to think positive, it's a time where we are all trying to find a silver lining in what is a very dark cloud... we will all get through this."=

2 May 08:38 • Irish Mirror • https://www.irishmirror.ie/showbiz/celebrity-news/phillip-schofields-extreme-new-style-21962035
Rating: 0.56
Phillip Schofield has given up on lockdown routine as he shows off unruly hair

Phillip Schofield has given up on his usual styling routines like the rest of us and showed off his new hair. The This Morning host debuted his unruly mane, looking rather similar to Dr. Emmett ‘Doc’ Brown from Back To The Future. Sharing a side-by-side picture to his Instagram, the 58-year-old captioned the post: ‘Lockdown hair options.’ One of the photos had Phillip slick his hair back with gel and all he’s missing is a tuxedo. Of course, the snap had to be black and white to add to the suave effect. Fans found the two styles hilarious, leaving jokes under his post. One fan made the perfect comparison, stating: ‘Is that like Tom Hardy vs Boris Johnson.’ However, some weren’t too appreciative of the slicked back look, writing: ‘Deffo the second look!😂😂’ Or maybe this comparison is more accurate: ‘Richard Gere V Freddie Boswell 🤣 ❤️ u Phil.’ The talk show host has been isolating in his new flat, after being spotted moving out of his £2 million family home after coming out as gay. However, Phillip and Holly Willoughby continue filming This Morning from the studio. And ITV boss Kevin Lygo has plans in place if the coronavirus pandemic ever forces the show out of ITV studios. Holly and Phil have been equipped with expensive cameras in their respective homes so they can continue filming the day time TV show as normal. Lygo said: ‘When it looked that lockdown was coming, I quickly went into what are our priorities here, what are the main things ITV should be doing? ‘I prioritised quite early the news and the regional news, we have to keep them on air, they must continue broadcasting for a long as possible.’ Got a story? If you’ve got a celebrity story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page – we’d love to hear from you.

2 May 11:58 • Metro • https://metro.co.uk/2020/05/02/philip-schofield-has-given-routines-shows-off-hair-12643981/
Rating: 2.18
Entertainment
In a world sitting on edge, a yellow house sits on ice

2 May 07:34 • 3 articles
Weight: 0.00
Importance: 1.80
Age penalty: 0.00
Best date: 2 May 07:34
Average US: 3.733333333333333
Weighted average US: 3.1681237569867884
Average GB: 0.0
Weighted average GB: 0.0
Average IN: 1.8333333333333333
Weighted average IN: 1.720587750415579

In a world sitting on edge, a yellow house sits on ice

Little did Emilia Memory know what was to come when she placed a yellow house on the edge of an iceberg. How her final year of secondary school would turn out. That her resulting artwork would end up being shown by Brisbane's Gallery of Modern Art. And that the piece would be shown virtually, as the world was plunged into a new unknown - brought about by the coronavirus pandemic. Ms Memory became one of 33 Queensland senior high school recipients of the annual Creative Generation Excellence Awards in visual art. The Lourdes Hill College graduate said she had no intention of her artwork going “anywhere” until her teacher nominated the piece. “I drew my first sketch based on where my headspace was at, at the time,” she said. “It's so surreal. I never would've thought I'd be someone to get into GOMA.” Ms Memory took the sketch-turned-installation a step further and photographed the work. She drew inspiration from artist James Casebere and architect Ricardo Bofill as well as National Geographic photographs. “At some point in a person’s life, they will confront places, people, things or situations that are foreign to them,” she said. “It could be moving to a new house, starting a new job or changing schools.” Ms Memory said uncertainty and fear crept in at the time of creation because she was beginning her first term in her final year of schooling. “It’s crazy that we’re talking about the theme of the unknown, where we are now, living during the pandemic,” she said. “What I learnt in my final year was that everything will work itself out.” Ms Memory is now studying a nursing diploma but continues to create art during her spare time. “I really want to get into fashion someday and somehow,” she said. “I honestly feel blessed and this exhibition is such a great opportunity that I hope it can open new avenues for me as well.” View the exhibition here until July 26.

2 May 07:34 • The Age • https://www.theage.com.au/national/queensland/in-a-world-sitting-on-edge-a-yellow-house-sits-on-ice-20200423-p54mha.html?ref=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_source=rss_national

In a world sitting on edge, a yellow house sits on ice

Little did Emilia Memory know what was to come when she placed a yellow house on the edge of an iceberg. How her final year of secondary school would turn out. That her resulting artwork would end up being shown by Brisbane's Gallery of Modern Art. And that the piece would be shown virtually, as the world was plunged into a new unknown - brought about by the coronavirus pandemic. Ms Memory became one of 33 Queensland senior high school recipients of the annual Creative Generation Excellence Awards in visual art. The Lourdes Hill College graduate said she had no intention of her artwork going “anywhere” until her teacher nominated the piece. “I drew my first sketch based on where my headspace was at, at the time,” she said. “It's so surreal. I never would've thought I'd be someone to get into GOMA.” Ms Memory took the sketch-turned-installation a step further and photographed the work. She drew inspiration from artist James Casebere and architect Ricardo Bofill as well as National Geographic photographs. “At some point in a person’s life, they will confront places, people, things or situations that are foreign to them,” she said. “It could be moving to a new house, starting a new job or changing schools.” Ms Memory said uncertainty and fear crept in at the time of creation because she was beginning her first term in her final year of schooling. “It’s crazy that we’re talking about the theme of the unknown, where we are now, living during the pandemic,” she said. “What I learnt in my final year was that everything will work itself out.” Ms Memory is now studying a nursing diploma but continues to create art during her spare time. “I really want to get into fashion someday and somehow,” she said. “I honestly feel blessed and this exhibition is such a great opportunity that I hope it can open new avenues for me as well.” View the exhibition here until July 26.

In a world sitting on edge, a yellow house sits on ice

“Scrubs” Actor Sam Lloyd Dies Aged 56

2 May 07:50 • 9 articles
Weight: 0.00
Importance: 1.46
Age penalty: 0.00
Best date: 2 May 07:44
Average US: 11.866666666666665
Weighted average US: 18.22408923179229
Average GB: 4.722222222222222
Weighted average GB: 6.2690355665421365
Average IN: 5.511111111111111
Weighted average IN: 7.473042918014056

“Scrubs” Actor Sam Lloyd Dies Aged 56

American actor Sam Lloyd, who was best known for his role as New Sacred Heart lawyer Ted Buckland on the long-running NBC-ABC medical comedy Scrubs, has died. Lloyd died Thursday night in Los Angeles, his agent, Kevin Turner, told The Hollywood Reporter. He was 56. In January 2019, Lloyd was diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour and cancer, which eventually spread to his lungs, jaw, liver and spine. He received the diagnosis just weeks after his wife, Vanessa, gave birth to their first child. Scrubs star Zach Braff paid tribute to Lloyd on Twitter, writing: “Rest In Peace to one of the funniest actors I’ve ever had the joy of working with. Sam Lloyd made me crack up and break character every single time we did a scene together. He could not have been a kinder man. I will forever cherish the time I had with you, Sammy.” “Scrubs” creator Bill Lawrence described him as a “kind, sweet guy” who will be missed by many. Lloyd was also a talented musician. He sang in a cappella group The Blanks – which made several appearances on “Scrubs” as The Worthless Peons. Lloyd appeared on 95 episodes of Scrubs as Buckland, he also reprised the role for another Lawrence series, Cougar Town. His other TV credits include Lawrence’s Spin City, Seinfeld, Desperate Housewives, Shameless, Modern Family and Happy Together. As for films, he was in Galaxy Quest and Flubber. Sam Lloyd is survived by his wife Vanessa and their son Weston.

2 May 07:50 • The Guardian • https://guardian.ng/life/scrubs-actor-sam-lloyd-dies-aged-56/
Rating: 0.30
Sam Lloyd, ‘Scrubs’ star, dies of brain tumour at 56

Sam Lloyd, an American actor renowned for his role as Ted Buckland in ‘Scrubs’, a comedy-drama television series, has died after battling a brain tumor. In January last year, the 56-year-old singer was diagnosed with an inoperable tumor and cancer, which eventually spread to his lungs, jaw, liver, and spine. Lloyd, however, breathed his last on Thursday, a year after Vanessa Lloyd, his wife, had given birth to their first child together. “Thinking a lot about Sam Lloyd today. (Ted). Truly such a kind, sweet guy. He will be missed by so many,” Bill Lawrence, the creator of ‘Scrubs’, said while confirming his death on Friday. “Rest In Peace to one of the funniest actors I’ve ever had the joy of working with,” Zach Braff, another US actor, who also played a role in ‘Scrubs’, wrote while paying tributes to the late actor. “Sam Lloyd made me crack up and break character every single time we did a scene together. He could not have been a kinder man. I will forever cherish the time I had with you, Sammy.” Lloyd is also known for his roles in a slew of TV shows including ‘Desperate Housewives’, ‘Happy Together’, ‘Shameless’, ‘The West Wing’, and ‘Modern Family’. He also had guest spots on ‘Spin City’ and ‘Seinfeld’ and notable credits in films like ‘Galaxy Quest’ and “Flubber’. The late actor is survived by his wife and a child. Copyright 2020 TheCable. All rights reserved. This material, and other digital content on this website, may not be reproduced, published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed in whole or in part without prior express written permission from TheCable.Follow us on twitter @Thecablestyle

2 May 09:56 • TheCable Lifestyle • https://lifestyle.thecable.ng/sam-lloyd-scrubs-star-dies-of-brain-tumour-at-56/
Rating: 0.30
Scrubs stars pay tribute to Sam Lloyd, aka Ted Buckland, as he dies aged 56

Scrubs stars have been paying tribute to Sam Lloyd, after the actor died aged 56. Lloyd, best known for playing lawyer Ted Buckland on the hospital comedy, passed away on 30 April. While his cause of death has yet to be confirmed, he had been battling cancer, having been diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour at the beginning of 2019. He was then diagnosed with metastatic lung cancer, which had spread to his liver, spine and jaw bone. Following the sad news, Sam’s Scrubs castmates shared tributes on social media, including Zach Braff, who played JD on the show. The 45-year-old tweeted: ‘Rest In Peace to one of the funniest actors I’ve ever had the joy of working with. Sam Lloyd made me crack up and break character every single time we did a scene together.  ‘He could not have been a kinder man. I will forever cherish the time I had with you, Sammy.’ Zach went on to share a clip of Sam singing Somewhere Over The Rainbow with his a capella group The Blanks, who made recurring appearances on Scrubs, as well as pictures of some of Lloyd’s most memorable scenes. Sarah Chalke, who played Elliot Reid, tweeted: ‘Oh Sam…I feel so lucky I got the chance to know and work with you. You were the the kindest, funniest man. Sending so much love to your family. Rest In Peace.’ Series creator Bill Lawrence posted a BTS picture from the show and wrote: ‘Thinking a lot about Sam Lloyd today. (Ted). Truly such a kind, sweet guy. He will be missed by so many.’ He added: ‘Spent the night watching clips of Sam (The songs! The greatest sweaty pratfall of all time!) Those who reached out, our “Scrubs family” appreciates it – he had the biggest heart of all of us.  ‘But now send all those good thoughts to his family. And to your own loved ones. #RIPTed.’ Actress Kate Micucci played Ted’s girlfriend Stephanie Gooch on the show, and posted a picture with Sam to Twitter. ‘So sad to hear the news about Sam Lloyd,’ she tweeted. ‘Sam was one of the warmest, funniest and most generous actors I’ve ever worked with. I loved getting to sing with him and it was an honor to play his girlfriend on Scrubs. He will be so missed.’ Robert Maschio, who played The Todd on Scrubs, tweeted a selfie with Sam and wrote: ‘Simpler times, happier days, the kindest man I ever met. Easy going Sam, Rest In Peace.’ Meanwhile, other actors who had worked with Sam on different shows also shared their condolences. The Masked Singer judge Ken Jeong tweeted: ‘I was just talking about Sam Lloyd and how amazing he was when he appeared on @DrKenABC. Oh man, this hurts. It was a true honor working with you. A genius and a gentleman. Rest In Peace.’ While Lloyd was best known for his role as miserable lawyer Ted, he also starred on shows including Seinfeld, The West Wing and Desperate Housewives, and reprised his role of Ted Buckland in Cougar Town.  Lloyd is survived by his wife Vanessa and their son Weston.

2 May 07:44 • Metro • https://metro.co.uk/2020/05/02/not-have-kinder-man-scrubs-stars-pay-tribute-sam-lloyd-dies-aged-56-12643251/
Rating: 2.18
Scrub Actor Sam Lloyd Dies at 53 Due to Brain Tumour And Cancer, Bill Lawrance, Zach Braff Pay Tribute

Scrubs actor Sam Lloyd, known for essaying the role of the lawyer Ted Buckland in the medical-comedy drama show, dies at the age of 56. In 2019, he was diagnosed with inoperable brain tumour and cancer, which eventually spread to his lungs, jaw, liver and spine. His death was confirmed by his agent to the international website Variety. Also Read - Prepare These Sugar Scrubs at Home And Exfoliate Your Skin During Lockdown Remembering the actor, Bill Lawrence, creator of Scrubs, shared a behind-the-scenes photo. “Thinking a lot about Sam Lloyd today. Truly such a kind, sweet guy. He will be missed by so many”, Lawrence wrote. Also Read - How to make oats scrub for soft knees and elbows Lloyd’s Scrubs co-star also posted in honour of Lloyd. “Rest In Peace to one of the funniest actors I’ve ever had the joy of working with. Sam Lloyd made me crack up and break character every single time we did a scene together,” Braff tweeted. The late actor was also slated to direct a country rock musical, With Pam And Gill, which was put on hold after his diagnosis. Lloyd also sang in a cappella group named The Blanks. The group made several appearances on Scrubs as The Worthless Peons. He also played the bass guitar in The Butties, a Beatles tribute band. Over the course of his three-decade career in television and film, Lloyd also featured in shows such as Desperate Housewives, Seinfeld, Modern Family, Malcolm In The Middle and Shameless, as well as films Flubber and Galaxy Quest. 2 May 12:48 • India News, Breaking News, Entertainment News | India.com • https://www.india.com/entertainment/scrub-actor-sam-lloyd-dies-at-53-due-to-brain-tumour-and-cancer-bill-lawrance-zach-braff-pay-tribute-4017685/
Rating: 0.30
Scrubs actor Sam Lloyd dies at 56

Actor Sam Lloyd, who was best known for playing lawyer Ted Buckland on medical comedy Scrubs, has died at the age of 56. In January 2019, Lloyd was diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour and cancer in January 2019, just weeks after his wife, Vanessa, gave birth to their first child. Lloyd had a successful thirty-year career in TV and film, appearing in Desperate Housewives, Seinfeld, Modern Family, The West Wing, Cougar Town, Malcolm in the Middle and Shameless, and films such as Flubber and Galaxy Quest. He was also a musician, singing in a cappella group The Blanks, who made several appearances on Scrubs as The Worthless Peons, and played bass guitar in The Butties, a Beatles tribute band.  He was also planning to direct a country rock musical entitled With Pam and Gil, which was put on hold when he fell ill.  Sharing a behind-the-scenes photo of Lloyd on Twitter, Scrubs creator Bill Lawrence, said, "Thinking a lot about Sam Lloyd today. Truly such a kind, sweet guy. He will be missed by so many." The late actor's Scrubs co-star Zach Braff also posted a tribute, which said, "Rest In Peace to one of the funniest actors I've ever had the joy of working with. Sam Lloyd made me crack up and break character every single time we did a scene together. "He could not have been a kinder man. I will forever cherish the time I had with you, Sammy." Braff also posted a video of Lloyd’s a cappella group singing Somewhere Over the Rainbow.

2 May 10:58 • RTE.ie • https://www.rte.ie/entertainment/2020/0502/1136243-scrubs-actor-sam-lloyd-dies-at-55/
Rating: 2.47
Zach Braff leads tributes to Scrubs co-star Sam Lloyd following his death aged 56

Tributes have been paid to actor Sam Lloyd, who was best known for playing lawyer Ted Buckland on medical comedy Scrubs, following his death at the age of 56. In January 2019,  the actor informed fans he had been diagnosed with cancer of the brain and lungs. Sam announced the news about his health just a month after welcoming a son named Weston with his wife, Vanessa. Sam’s co-stars from the popular comedy series took to social media to pay heartfelt tributes to him after the tragic news of his death broke yesterday. Zach Braff, who played John ‘JD’ Dorian in Scrubs, wrote on Twitter: "Rest In Peace to one of the funniest actors I've ever had the joy of working with. “Sam Lloyd made me crack up and break character every single time we did a scene together.” He added: "He could not have been a kinder man. I will forever cherish the time I had with you, Sammy." Bill Lawrence, creator of Scrubs, tweeted: "Thinking a lot about Sam Lloyd today. (Ted). Truly such a kind, sweet guy. He will be missed by so many." Sam’s co-star Robert Maschio penned: “Simpler times, happier days, the kindest man I ever met. “Easy going Sam, Rest In Peace. #RIPSamLloyd.” After Sam was diagnosed with cancer, the cast and crew of Scrubs supported him by launching a GoFundMe page to help him in his fight against the disease. The page was updated in March to share news about Sam celebrating his young son’s first birthday. The post, updated by Scrubs writer Tim Hobert, read: "In the 13 months since Sam’s original diagnosis, with help from you guys (incredible people from all over the world), he has made the most of the time that he has been given. "He was able to go back to his home state of Vermont and play his annual gig with his Beatles band, The Butties. "He was able to do guest spots on Modern Family and American Housewife that allowed him to qualify for the Screen Actors Guild insurance policy.” The post continued: “He was able to spend time with dear friends, help his mother in the last stages of her life, and sing for her at her funeral, and most importantly, he was able to spend time with his wife, Vanessa, and celebrate Weston’s first birthday!" The GoFundMe page raised over $150,000 towards the actor's medical bills. Sam had begun to suffer headaches and after losing 10lbs and with the headaches continuing, he decided to get a CT scan. The scan revealed a mass on his brain and he was taken in to have brain surgery, but the tumour was unfortunately too intertwined, so the surgeons couldn’t remove it. Sam and his wife were then told by doctors that the cancer in his brain had metastasized from his lungs. Further scans showed the cancer was also in his liver, spine, and jaw. Sam, who was the nephew of Back to the Future star Christopher Lloyd, played Ted Buckland in 95 episodes of Scrubs. Alongside his acting career, he was a talented singer and performed with the A cappella group The Blanks. Sam also had roles in Cougar Town, Desperate Housewives, and appeared as the character Ricky on Seinfeld.

2 May 14:43 • Buzz.ie • https://www.buzz.ie/news/zach-braff-tributes-to-scrubs-sam-lloyd-death-aged-56-366836
Rating: 0.30
Sam Lloyd - the actor who played Ted in Scrubs - has died aged 56

US ACTOR SAM Lloyd has died aged 56, a year and four months after he was diagnosed with a brain tumour.  The actor was well-known for his portrayal of lawyer Ted Buckland in the long-running comedy series Scrubs. He also appeared in a string of US shows in the past two decades, including The West Wing, Desperate Housewives, Modern Family and Malcolm in The Middle. Away from acting, Lloyd was also an accomplished singer and musician and performed with the a cappella group The Blanks.  Scrubs co-star Zach Braff paid tribute on Twitter, saying: “Rest In Peace to one of the funniest actors I’ve ever had the joy of working with. Sam Lloyd made me crack up and break character every single time we did a scene together. Fellow Scrubs actor Robert Maschio described Lloyd as the “kindest man I ever met”. A GoFundMe page to raise money for Sam Lloyd and his family has raised – at the time of writing – $171,000. Lloyd was survived by his wife Vanessa and his one-year-old son Weston. #Open journalism No news is bad news Support The Journal Your contributions will help us continue to deliver the stories that are important to you Support us now

2 May 10:05 • TheJournal.ie • https://www.thejournal.ie/sam-lloyd-scrubs-5090149-May2020/
Rating: 1.13
'Scrubs' actor Sam Lloyd has died

Sam Lloyd, best known as sad-sack lawyer Ted Buckland on Scrubs, died Friday. He was 56. The actor had been diagnosed with lung cancer in January 2019, per Entertainment Weekly, only weeks after his wife, Vanessa, gave birth to their first child. At the time, doctors discovered an inoperable tumor in his brain.  Lloyd, who is the nephew of Back to the Future star Christopher Lloyd, had screen career spanning three decades. He jumped between TV and film, in projects as wide-ranging as Flubber, Galaxy Quest, Seinfeld, The West Wing, and Desperate Housewives.  In addition to his work as an actor, Lloyd was an accomplished musician with the a cappella group The Blanks (which Scrubs fans might recognize as The Worthless Peons) and the Beatles cover band The Butties. But Lloyd was probably most recognizable as Ted on Scrubs, appearing in all nine seasons and even reprising the role for a guest arc in Cougar Town.  Some of Lloyd's former colleagues paid tribute to him on social media, including Scrubs star Zach Braff and Scrubs and Cougar Town creator Bill Lawrence. 

2 May 02:01 • Mashable • https://mashable.com/article/sam-lloyd-scrubs-died/?europe=true&utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Mashable+%28Mashable%29
Rating: 2.28
Scrubs Actor Sam Lloyd Has Died Aged 56

Actor Sam Lloyd has died aged 56. Lloyd is most well-known for playing hospital lawyer Ted Buckland in Scrubs. He appeared in 95 episodes of the series which ran from 2001 - 2009. A career which began in the late 80s also saw him make appearances in Seinfeld, Mad About You, The West Wing, 3rd Rock From The Sun, Spin City, Desperate Housewives, Modern Family and Galaxy Quest. He was also a member of a capella group The Blanks which appeared on Scrubs. Entertainment Weekley reported that Llyod had been diagnosed with cancer in January 2019 when doctors discovered an inoperable brain tumour. Actor Zach Braff, who was one of the main stars of Scrubs, paid tribute to Lloyd. "Rest In Peace to one of the funniest actors I’ve ever had the joy of working with," Braff said on Twitter. "Sam Lloyd made me crack up and break character every single time we did a scene together. He could not have been a kinder man. I will forever cherish the time I had with you, Sammy." Scrubs creator Bill Lawrence also paid tribute. "Thinking a lot about Sam Lloyd today," he said. "Truly such a kind, sweet guy. He will be missed by so many. "Spent the night watching clips of Sam (The songs! The greatest sweaty pratfall of all time!) Those who reached out, our “Scrubs family” appreciates it - he had the biggest heart of all of us. But now send all those good thoughts to his family. And to your own loved ones."

Ariana Grande, Justin Bieber announce new song 'Stuck With U', all proceeds go to COVID-19 relief

2 May 10:56 • 7 articles
Weight: 0.00
Importance: 2.73
Age penalty: 0.00
Best date: 2 May 06:49
Average US: 9.285714285714285
Weighted average US: 9.980266474856958
Average GB: 0.1714285714285714
Weighted average GB: 0.2903926319275845
Average IN: 31.91428571428571
Weighted average IN: 27.181612095465752

Ariana Grande, Justin Bieber announce new song 'Stuck With U', all proceeds go to COVID-19 relief

WASHINGTON: American singer Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber have teamed up to help others in need during the COVID-19 pandemic. Grande and Bieber announced on Friday(local time) that they are working on a song, 'Stuck With U,' which will drop next week with all proceeds slated to go to coronavirus relief. The 26-year-old songstress Ariana tweeted on Friday, "Stuck with u by me and @justinbieber out May 8th. head to my Instagram for more info. thank u to @1strcf and @sb_projects for making this possible." Grande also announced the news on Instagram, and wrote, "Grateful to announce that my friend and i have partnered with @1strcf and @sb_projects on this release. proceeds from the streams and sales of #stuckwithu will be donated to first responders children's foundation to fund grants and scholarships for children of healthcare workers, emergency medical technicians (EMTs), paramedics, police officers and firefighters serving at the front lines during the global pandemic." The 26-year-old pop-star Bieber, also added in a statement, "More than ever we are seeing the selfless, tireless and amazing work that doctors, nurses and healthcare providers give to the world every day. It is our hope we can lend our voices to raise awareness and give much-needed support for them and their families. It's my honour to come together with my friend Ariana and our SB Projects family to try and do some good." The two music superstars have also independently been helping people in need. According to sources to Page Six, Grande, who has been communicating her longing to make music during the quarantine, has sent fans between 500 and 1,000 USD using the Venmo app. One of the Ariana fans told Page Six that the 'Senorita' singer "took care of my salary for the month." She has helped more than 20 fans, said the outlet. The '7 rings' singer also joined the Disney family singalong in April and sang 'I Won't Say I'm In Love' the animated film 'Hercules.' Back in February, Bieber cantered his efforts on China, saying at the time that he "couldn't imagine how scary it would be if a new disease was effecting my wife and my family and friends." The 'Yummy' singer said he made a donation to the country and urged his followers to join in on the conversation. Bieber also accepted the #AllInChallenge to raise money for COVID relief. The singer said he will fly to your house for a private concert and sing 'One Less Lonely Girl.'

2 May 10:56 • The New Indian Express • https://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/english/2020/may/02/ariana-grande-justin-bieber-announce-new-song-stuck-with-u-all-proceeds-go-to-covid-19-relief-2138213.html
Rating: 2.04
You could be in the music video for Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber's new track

Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber are teaming up for a new track, and they want fans to be a part of it. Grande and Bieber made the announcement Friday, on their respective social media pages. The song, called "Stuck With U," is set to be released on May 8, with proceeds going to the First Responder Children's Foundation, to fund grants and scholarships for children of health care workers, EMTs, paramedics, police officers and firefighters on the frontlines, Grande said. But wait, there's more. Bieber and Grande went ahead and posted an instrumental version of the song, instructing their fans to tweet videos of themselves dancing to the track -- in the prom dresses or suits they didn't get to wear, with their dogs or just alone in whatever is comfy. The fan videos will end up as a part of the music video for the track when it's released. Grande and Bieber aren't the first artists to release new music during the pandemic, with proceeds going to frontline workers. Internationally renowned Nigerian singer Davido released his new music video, "Dolce & Gabbana," last month, and announced all proceeds would go to the Dolce & Gabbana and Humanitas Together for Coronavirus Research fund. U2 singer Bono also wrote a new song back in March, called "Let Your Love Be Known," dedicated to health care workers on the frontlines and anyone struggling.

2 May 18:41 • CTVNews • https://www.ctvnews.ca/entertainment/you-could-be-in-the-music-video-for-ariana-grande-and-justin-bieber-s-new-track-1.4922196
Rating: 2.87
Aliel: Egypt’s favorite mini-bag brand

LOS ANGELES: Pop superstars Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande are teaming up for the first time on a duet that will fund scholarships for the children of health and emergency workers on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic. The duet, called "Stuck With U," will be released on May 8, the two singers announced on Friday on Instagram, where they jointly have some 316 million followers. All net proceeds from streaming and sales of the duet will be donated to the First Responders Children's Foundation to fund grants and scholarships for the children of those working during the pandemic. Bieber, 26, and Grande, 26, two of the biggest young singers in the United States with hits like "Love Yourself" and "Thank U, Next," have never recorded a song together. "We hope we make a big difference with this and we hope it uplifts you and makes you feel happy," Grande said in a statement. The single is the first in series from Scooter Braun, who manages both singers, that will benefit charities during the year, Braun said.

2 May 07:57 • Arab News • https://www.arabnews.com/node/1668456/lifestyle
Rating: 1.72
Ariana Grande & Justin Bieber Announce Their New Song, ‘Stuck With U’ Amid Lockdown

Amid the COVID-19 pandemic crisis, American singer Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber have teamed up to help people. On Friday, Ariana and Justin announced that the duo is working on a song titled ‘Stuck With U’. Stuck With U is most likely to release next week with all proceeds slated to go to coronavirus relief funds. Ariana Grande took to Twitter to announce the news with her fans. The songstress wrote: ‘Stuck with u by me and @justinbieber out May 8th. head to my Instagram for more info. thank u to @1strcf and @sb_projects for making this possible.’ Take a look: Ariana Grande also announced the news on Instagram, and wrote, “Grateful to announce that my friend and i have partnered with @1strcf and @sb_projects on this release. proceeds from the streams and sales of #stuckwithu will be donated to first responders children’s foundation to fund grants and scholarships for children of healthcare workers, emergency medical technicians (EMTs), paramedics, police officers and firefighters serving at the front lines during the global pandemic.” The 26-year-old pop-star Bieber, also added in a statement, “More than ever we are seeing the selfless, tireless and amazing work that doctors, nurses and healthcare providers give to the world every day. It is our hope we can lend our voices to raise awareness and give much-needed support for them and their families. It’s my honour to come together with my friend Ariana and our SB Projects family to try and do some good.” The music superstars Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber have also independently been helping people in need. According to sources to Page Six, Grande, who has been communicating her longing to make music during the quarantine, has sent fans between 500 and 1,000 USD using the Venmo app. One of the Ariana fans told Page Six that the ‘Senorita’ singer “took care of my salary for the month. She has helped more than 20 fans,” said the outlet. Bieber also accepted the #AllInChallenge to raise money for COVID relief. The singer said he will fly to your house for a private concert and sing ‘One Less Lonely Girl.’ Are you excited for Stuck With U? Let us know in the comments section below.

Rating: 1.65
Justin Bieber, Ariana Grande team up to benefit front line workers

Pop superstars Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande are teaming up for the first time on a duet that will fund scholarships for the children of health and emergency workers on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic. The duet, called ‘Stuck With U,’ will be released on May 8, the two singers announced on Friday on Instagram, where they jointly have some 316 million followers. All net proceeds from streaming and sales of the duet will be donated to the First Responders Children’s Foundation to fund grants and scholarships for the children of those working during the pandemic. Bieber, 26, and Grande, 26, two of the biggest young singers in the United States with hits like ‘Love Yourself’ and ‘Thank U, Next,’ have never recorded a song together. “We hope we make a big difference with this and we hope it uplifts you and makes you feel happy,” Grande said in a statement. The single is the first in series from Scooter Braun, who manages both singers, that will benefit charities during the year, Braun said. (FILES) In this file photo Canadian singer Justin Bieber arrives for YouTube Originals' "Justin Bieber: Seasons" premiere at the Regency Bruin Theatre in Los Angeles on January 27, 2020. Celine Dion, Justin Bieber and Margaret Atwood were among the Canadian celebrities who joined for a broadcast event Sunday to honor healthcare workers battling the coronavirus pandemic and raise money for food banks. The "Stronger Together/Tous Ensemble" event, which was broadcast on radio, television and streamed online, brought together Canadian personalities who sang or delivered messages of solidarity from their living rooms or -- in the case of Dion -- their kitchens. / AFP / LISA O'CONNOR Image Credit: AFPView gallery as list

2 May 06:49 • Gulf News • https://gulfnews.com/entertainment/hollywood/justin-bieber-ariana-grande-team-up-to-benefit-front-line-workers-1.71290019
Rating: 3.21
Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande reveal release date for their new single

Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande announced on Friday that they are teaming up on a joint single, "Stuck with U," to raise money for the First Responders Children’s Foundation. Justin Bieber shared the news on Twitter with an illustration, by artist Liana Finck, showing two people together in a home, with a clear reference to the self-isolation many people are facing as the coronavirus pandemic continues to affect millions around the world. "Very excited because we have finally done it," said Bieber about the collaboration with Grande, in a caption. "And it’s really good." Bieber and Grande, as well as their manager Scooter Braun, teased fans with the announcement on Thursday afternoon on Twitter, with Bieber writing, "Special announcement tomorrow at 10 am" and Grande posting "see u there everybody" with a black heart emoji. According to Billboard, the single will be the first release from a compilation album organized by Scooter Braun’s SB Projects. Grande said; "I’m so excited to announce that my friend Justin Bieber and I have partnered with SB Projects and First Responders Children’s Foundation on this little project here." "We’re very excited about this for so many reasons. "We hope we make a big difference with this and we hope it uplifts you and makes you feel happy and that you love it as much as we do. "We’ve had a really great time working on this and we’re so excited for you to hear it." The song, available on preorder, will be released on Friday, May 8.

Justin Bieber, Ariana Grande team up to benefit frontline workers

LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Pop superstars Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande are teaming up for the first time on a duet that will fund scholarships for the children of health and emergency workers on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic. The duet, called “Stuck With U,” will be released on May 8, the two singers announced on Friday on Instagram, where they jointly have some 316 million followers. All net proceeds from streaming and sales of the duet will be donated to the First Responders Children’s Foundation to fund grants and scholarships for the children of those working during the pandemic. Bieber, 26, and Grande, 26, two of the biggest young singers in the United States with hits like “Love Yourself” and “Thank U, Next,” have never recorded a song together. “We hope we make a big difference with this and we hope it uplifts you and makes you feel happy,” Grande said in a statement. The single is the first in series from Scooter Braun, who manages both singers, that will benefit charities during the year, Braun said.

Selena Gomez Looks Absolutely Gorgeous In Makeup-Free Selfie: ‘Today I’m Choosing Happiness’

While Selena Gomez remains in lockdown due to the coronavirus, she’s making sure to keep a positive attitude by leaving herself uplifting post-it notes on her mirror. Her cosmetics brand Rare Beauty posted an Instagram photo of their boss on May 1, nearly makeup free while taking a selfie. Selena is looking down at her phone and smiling in the pic, looking so gorgeous with her hair pulled back and wearing a casual black crew-neck sweater. It’s the message in the mirror that has her appearing so content. On a post-it with her cosmetic brand’s name at the top, it reads “I am in charge of how I feel today. I am choosing happiness.” In the caption her brand posted, “Choose happiness. Every month is Mental Health Awareness Month – we’ll be sharing more resources, community stories and ways we stay positive all month long. Enjoy your weekend, log off and do something that makes you feel good. #mentalhealthawarenessmonth #rarereminder.” May 1 marks the beginning of Mental Health Awareness Month, and Selena has long been an advocate of taking care of one’s mental health, as well as erasing the stigma around it. Selena, 27, has been open about her struggles with anxiety and depression. She made a new revelation to Miley Cyrus, 27, on the “Wrecking Ball” singer’s Apr. 3 Instagram Live show, BRIGHT MINDED: Live With Miley that she’s bipolar. “Recently, I went to one of the best hospitals in the world — or definitely in America — McLean [Hospital, in Massachusetts], and I discussed that after going through years of a lot of different things, I realized that I was bipolar,” Selena told Miley. “And so, when I know more information it actually helps me; it doesn’t scare me once I know it. And I think people get scared of that…I’m from Texas, where it’s not known to talk about your mental health. You’ve got to seem cool.” Selena’s first connection to McLean was in Sept. 2019, when the Boston-area psychiatric hospital gave her an award at their annual dinner for her efforts to raise awareness about mental health. Selena posed with her award in a photo that she posted to her Instagram account and wrote next to it, “So humbled to have been part of the incredible McLean Hospital’s Annual Dinner and was honored to be able to share a bit of my story. Thank you Dr. Rauch for inviting me and spending time speaking with me about mental health. And thank you to all the amazing staff at McLean. And a huge thank you to (film director) David O. Russell for connecting me with these amazing humans. These are the moments where I am so grateful for the platform God has given me.” It turns out the connection was a tight one, as Selena returned and was able to work with McLean’s doctors to realize that she was dealing with bipolar disorder.

2 May 04:58 • Hollywood Life • https://hollywoodlife.com/2020/05/02/selena-gomez-makeup-free-selfie-choosing-happiness-pic/
Rating: 1.32
Eden Levine Shows Off Major Sideboob In Skimpy Lingerie On Instagram

May 1, 2020 Sarah Batool Haider Instagram model Eden Levine recently took to her account and wowed her fans with a very sexy, lingerie snapshot. In the pic, which was uploaded to the photo-sharing website on Friday, May 1, Eden could be seen rocking sexy silk lingerie that allowed her to show off a lot of skin. To strike a pose for the pic, she lied on her bed over her belly and flashed major sideboob to tease her fans. That’s not all, but the picture also captured an eyeful of her pert booty. Staying true to her signature style, she sported a full face of makeup. The application featured foundation, a pink lipstick combined with a slick of gloss, nude eyeshadow, heavily lined eyes, and a thick coat of mascara. Eden dusted her cheeks with a pink blush and highlighter, while she finished off her makeup application with dark, well-defined eyebrows. She wore her raven-colored tresses in soft curls and swept them to one side. In the caption, Eden shared an incident with her fans, telling them that she burned herself while curling her hair with an iron rod. She also asked her followers to watch her latest Instagram Stories where she shared screenshots of how people troll her and other models on social media. Within eight hours of going live, the snap garnered more than 8,700 likes. Some of her fans also flocked to the comments section and posted above 220 comments in which they praised Eden for her sexiness. Not only that, but many users also extended their support because she has to face a lot of trolling on a daily basis. “I love you, sweetheart! You are outstandingly beautiful, gorgeous, and nice,” one of her fans commented on the snap. “Wow, so beautiful. Happy Friday, I hope you have a great weekend,” another user chimed in. “Sorry, darling. You have to deal with trolls. You are beautiful, confident, and brave! Keep it up!” a third admirer remarked. Meanwhile, a fourth follower asked Eden to marry him. “How can someone be this gorgeous and perfect? Will you be my wife?” they wrote. Other users posted words and phrases like “goddess,” “very, very pretty,” and “I love you,” to express their admiration for the model. Aside from her regular followers, many of Eden’s fellow models and influencers also liked and commented on the snap to show appreciation, including Pandora Blue, Viviana Castrillon, Gia Macool, and Rachel Ann Cook. Eden likes to show off her feminine curves in a variety of revealing outfits. Not too long ago, she gave her fans an eyeful of cleavage in a photo that featured her wearing a stunning red dress.

Rating: 0.30
Eva Mendes Gives A Classic Reply To Fan Questioning Ryan Gosling’s Parenting

While social media has its own perks, it has some disadvantages too, and who better than celebrities know it! We see quite often fans commenting about celebs’ personal life and create a whole scene out of it and one such instance was witnessed with actress Eva Mendes, as one user questioned the Ryan Gosling’s parenting. On Thursday, Eva Mendes shared a picture on Instagram with a caption that reads, “Tired Mama. Stayed up laaate trying to make my baby’s 4th birthday extra special since she won’t see the family. Here’s to all you having a quarantine birthday …sending extra love. Here’s to all you tired mamas…sending extra love.” One of her fans commented, “Hi Eva, hope you will answer to my question. I really love you, really I do, but yesterday under your latest I saw that someone had thought what sometimes I thought about your post. I mean sometimes you seem a struggle single mother and we know that you have a man, but the way you write, I mean, seems that your husband let the hard job to you and he doesn’t help you.” Without ignoring the comment, Eva Mendes was quick to reply and her answer literally won our hearts. She wrote, “I love women. I’m a girls’ girl. I love connecting to women. That’s mainly why I have this page. So when I say I’m a ‘tired mama’ and want to connect to other ‘tired mamas’ it’s not about excluding the fathers or other caregivers that do so much. It’s just me connecting to other women but in no way does it de-value what papas do.” “And why I don’t talk about Ryan and all the wonderful things he does as a father is because I keep that part private. I don’t want to involve him or how he parents because I don’t feel comfortable crossing that boundary that I have set for myself,” she continued. “I feel it’s best that I continue to disclose what I’m comfortable with but not involve him or my kids too much. It’s not about being cagey or weird, it’s just about staying private in a public space. Does that make sense? Hope so. Because this is my honest answer and I really do love connecting to you women,” she concluded. What’s your thought on Eva Mendes’ reply?

Christopher Meloni Will Return To ‘Law & Order: SVU’ For The Season 22 Premiere

2 May 14:34 • 3 articles

Average GB: 0.2333333333333333

Average IN: 4.666666666666666
Weighted average IN: 4.391214224263264

Christopher Meloni Will Return To ‘Law & Order: SVU’ For The Season 22 Premiere

May 2, 2020 Joe Allen The actor left the show after its 12th season. Elliot Stabler is making his return. On a behind-the-scenes podcast, Law & Order: SVU showrunner Warren Leight said that Christopher Meloni will be making his return to the show in the season 22 premiere. Meloni was a member of the show’s original cast, but left the show after 12 seasons. He played Elliot Stabler, the partner of Mariska Hargitay’s Olivia Benson. “It’s pretty clear that Elliot will be in the SVU season opener. I think that much I know,” Leigh said of Meloni’s return to the show. Because of the COVID-19 pandemic, Leight said it’s not currently clear when the new show will start shooting. Meloni’s character was originally supposed to return at the end of season 21, but those plans were eventually scrapped after the coronavirus pandemic cut the season short. Stabler was also supposed to appear alongside his wife and son, but Leight is unsure whether that will still be the case moving forward. “Whether we’ll get to see his family as well remains to be seen,” he said. Stabler left the Special Victims Unit at the end of the show’s 12th season and retired, citing the emotional toll that the job had taken on him. The news of Stabler’s return to the world of SVU shouldn’t come as a shock. It follows the announcement that Meloni would be getting his own spin-off set in the world of the original show, but focused on his character. The new drama is set to revolve around Stabler leading an organized crime unit in the NYPD. The show has been given an initial 13-episode order, but little else is known about what it will involve. Entertainment Weekly reports that Chicago P.D.‘s Matt Olmstead is currently being eyed as a potential showrunner for the new series. Since leaving SVU roughly a decade ago, Meloni has picked up parts in a variety of other projects, largely on TV. He starred in the Syfy series Happy! and also had roles in shows like Underground and Maxxx, as well as a memorable guest arc on The Handmaid’s Tale. Speculation has already begun as to what Meloni’s new series may be called. It’s possible that the show will be another in the Law & Order series, or it could decide to take its branding in a new direction. Much like the show it has been spun-off from, there is no set premiere date for the new project, in large part because of the COVID-19 crisis.

2 May 14:34 • The Inquisitr • https://www.inquisitr.com/6030367/christopher-meloni-svu-return/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+google%2FyDYq+%28The+Inquisitr+-+News%29
Rating: 0.30
Christopher Meloni Returning to 'Law & Order: SVU' in Season 22 Premiere Ahead of New Spinoff

Christopher Meloni will be reprising his role as Elliot Stabler on Law & Order: Special Victims Unit ahead of the upcoming spinoff centered around his character created by longtime producer Dick Wolf. While fans were thrilled last month to learn Meloni would be returning to the Law & Order universe, many wondered if and when he would be reunited with Mariska Hargitay’s Olivia Benson on SVU. On the latest episode of The Law & Order: SVU Podcast, showrunner Warren Leight revealed that Stabler will be back on their screens sooner rather than later, with his first appearance on the SVU Season 22 premiere. “It’s pretty clear that Elliot will be in the SVU season opener,” Leight said, as per Entertainment Tonight. “I think that much I know. Whether we get to see his family as well remains to be seen.” The original plan for Leight and other writers Julie Martin, Denis Hamill and Monet Hurst-Mendoza was to bring Stabler back with his family gradually. Leight said, "We had heard distant thunder about Chris Meloni coming back in the fall and we were going to lay a little groundwork for that. We were going to see [wife] Kathy Stabler come back very upset. Her son had been rolled by a team of ne'er-do-wells and may have been drugged, and we were going to revisit [Benson’s half-brother] Simon's seeming overdose and we were going to get to know the stresses on the Stablers — what had happened to the Stabler family after Elliot both left SVU and apparently left them." But when Season 21 came to an early end due to the production shutdown caused by coronavirus, plans changed. "We were just going to lay some groundwork down in anticipation of Elliot's return of course in his own series. We had the sense that the first episode of next year for SVU was going to bring Elliot back, so we were going to foreshadow that and explain a little more what happened to Simon," Leight explained. News of the spinoff first broke in March, with few details revealed at the time other than that Meloni would return to his role as Stabler again in a new series following his returns to the NYPD to head the Organized Crime Division. Martin said that with "a 10-year gap of no reference point whatsoever," there's a lot of background to fill in with where Stabler has been and how he has grown, but that it provides plenty of opportunity for crossover with his former partner in SVU as they move forward.

2 May 19:56 • popculture. • https://popculture.com/tv-shows/news/christopher-meloni-returning-law-order-svu-season-22-premiere-ahead-new-spinoff/
Rating: 0.74
Christopher Meloni to return to ‘Law and Order: SVU’

Christopher Meloni, known for his role as Elliot Stabler, will return to Dick Wolf’s Law and Order SVU for its 22nd season, according to showrunner Warren Leight. Leight confirmed on the SVU podcast on Wednesday that Stabler will at the least appear in the season opener. “It’s pretty clear that Elliot will be in the SVU season opener. I think that much I know.” The news of Christopher Meloni’s return comes a month after it was announced that his character would be getting his own show about leading his own crime unit. No air date has been announced as of yet. After starring alongside Mariska Hargitay, who plays Elliot’s former partner Olivia Benson, Meloni left the SVU squad following season 12. Stabler went into retirement, citing the emotional toll of the job. Leight also said that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it is unclear when filming of the 22nd season will begin. It is still unclear if the entire Stabler family will be in the new season’s opening episode. “Whether we’ll get to see his family as well remains to be seen,” says Leight. Stabler and his family were slated to appear at the end of the show’s 21st season, however, this idea was eventually cut when the pandemic curtailed shooting.

Joe Wicks: I'll be back for PE after surgery

2 May 19:13 • 3 articles

Average GB: 35.3
Weighted average GB: 35.3
Average IN: 6.933333333333334
Weighted average IN: 6.933333333333334

Joe Wicks: I'll be back for PE after surgery

Joe Wicks says he will be back for his PE class on Monday after having surgery on his hand. The Body Coach, 33, has been updating fans with his progress while in hospital after falling off his bike. He said the surgery is over and paid tribute to the NHS. “The wires have been taken out…. it was infected,” he said in a video on Instagram Stories. “I’m staying in tonight to have…  antibiotics and a bit more paracetamol then I’ll be home tomorrow morning, back to my family. “So see you Monday morning, PE With Joe.” Earlier, Wicks, who is donating the money raised from his online PE lessons to the NHS, posted a video of himself “gowned up” with “the socks on” and waiting for his operation. He said the pain from the “infection” in his hand was “throbbing and pulsating like liquid hot magma”. Wicks said he was “super grateful for the health system we’ve got” and “the NHS people who are out here still grafting”. Wicks also said his wife would help out on Monday. “I’ve just asked my lovely wife Rosie to help me on Monday morning and she’s kindly agreed,” he said. “It’s well out of her comfort zone but she’s my best friend and she knows how much this means to me. “I don’t want to let anyone down but I don’t think I’m going to be able to demo many exercises so I’ll be having Rosie on camera with me.” Wicks added: “I’ll still lead the session and coach you through it. “I’ll just have Rosie demonstrating the moves.” 

2 May 19:13 • The Irish News • http://www.irishnews.com/magazine/entertainment/2020/05/02/news/joe-wicks-gives-updates-on-hand-injury-from-hospital-1924259/

Best of the week: What to see, hear and do in Sydney from May 3-9

Weighted average IN: 1.720587750415579

Best of the week: What to see, hear and do in Sydney from May 3-9

TALK For those after food for thought, American theoretical physicist Sean Carroll speaks at online live event Our Preposterous Universe, at which he unravels the mysteries of existence touching on science and more philosophical ideas. Noon, $20, thinkinc.org.au PODCAST Crime buffs will want to check out Naked City, the gritty new podcast for The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age featuring long-time crime reporter John Silvester speaking about the most dangerous criminals he's come across during 40 years on the beat. Available via Apple Podcasts and Spotify MUSIC Creative types young and old can make their very own dream collaboration with Triple J Unearthed’s DIY Supergroup letting songwriters play around with a sample pack featuring sounds from Flume, Tame Impala, Amy Shark, G Flip and more. The finished tracks can be uploaded and possibly score national airplay (entries close May 17). triplejunearthed.com BOOKS Australian novelist James Bradley's latest Ghost Species (Hamish Hamilton, $29.99) follows a scientist drawn into a secret program to resurrect the Neanderthals during a time of climate catastrophe. Catch Bradley tonight in conversation with author and academic Tony Birch for an online Zoom launch of the book. 6.30pm, free, betterreadevents.com FOOD Regatta Rose Bay have announced a new executive chef, with Sicilian-born Dionisio Randazzo taking the reins and a fresh takeaway and ready-to-bake menu for home feasting. Dishes available include mushroom risotto, barbecued spatchcock and lasagne. 5-9pm, Regatta Rose Bay, 594 New South Head Road, Rose Bay, various prices, regattarosebay.com ART While Manly Art Gallery and Museum is closed, an exhibition drawn from their archives, 90 Years: Treasures from the Vault, can be seen through a 24/7 window display. A new work from the show will be featured each day on the gallery's Instagram Stories. Manly Art Gallery and Museum, West Esplanade Reserve, Manly, free, magam.com.au STAGE After a very successful foray into live-streamed play readings last month, Red Line Productions returns with A-list actor Rose Byrne alongside Ewen Leslie to bring to life Rajiv Joseph's drama Gruesome Playground Injuries. This time they've also enlisted John Butler to provide live musical accompaniment. 10.30am, free or by donation, redlineproductions.com.au

2 May 06:00 • The Age • https://www.theage.com.au/culture/art-and-design/best-of-the-week-what-to-see-hear-and-do-in-sydney-from-may-3-9-20200430-p54ole.html?ref=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_source=rss_feed
Rating: 2.20

Rebel Wilson Unzips for Flirty Quarantine Photoshoot Following Dramatic Transformation

Actress and comedian Rebel Wilson is thriving in quarantine, and we are in absolute awe! The 40-year-old actress took to Instagram on May 2 to share snapshots from her smoking at-home photoshoot, showing off a slimmed-down figure while sporting a light blue tracksuit. Flaunting her enviable, curvy figure while rocking an unzipped hoodie and exposing her black bra, Wilson captioned the carousel of snaps: "At Home With Rebel" alongside a kissy emoji. The photos have raked up more than half a million likes, and a plethora of comments. In the first snap, Wilson channels her inner Victoria's Secret model, posing on top of her lush white sofa and smizing like a professional. In the following image, the Pitch Perfect actress stands defiantly in front of the camera, with her leg popped out with her fingers at the bottom of track suit jacket's zipper. In her last photo, Wilson channels her Cats role as she crawls toward the camera. Fans chimed into the fiery shoot, expressing their enthusiasm over the shoot with a string of emojis including flames, heart eyes and kissy faces. "Woah.. well hello Rebel [eye emoji] your (sic) such a little Rebel.. [heart eyes emoji] but when are u gonna tell us about what u was rehearsing the other day?" wrote one fan, as another added, "Work it girl!" Meanwhile another fan wrote, "Damnn Rebel Wilson !! Looking beautiful as always." At the beginning of the year, Wilson wrote in an Instagram post that 2020 would be "The Year of Health," admitting it was time to put herself first. "I put on the athleisure and went out for a walk, deliberately hydrating on the couch right now and trying to avoid the sugar and junk food which is going to be hard after the holidays I've just had but I'm going to do it!" she wrote. "Who's with me in making some positive changes this year?" According to Hollywood Life, Wilson's dramatic transformation is all thanks to trainer, Jono Castano Acero who told the outlet that he encourages clients to an "extra bit" of cardio every day to keep moving. "A little tip is to get a watch or use your phone to count steps and aim for 10 thousand steps a day," he said. "If you're on 9000 steps at 10pm, you have to get it done." The fitness trainer adds that while Wilson is "one of the sweetest souls" he's ever met, the pair oftentimes end up burning a major dose of calories from all their laughing together. The actress has long been an advocate for plus-size women and launched her own fashion line in 2017 called Rebel Wilson X Angels, designed specifically for sizes 14 to 24.

Kylie Jenner hints at sexy time with Travis Scott in seductive pose

Kylie Jenner has fans hearts racing as she hinted she may be enjoying more than co-parenting with baby daddy Travis Scott. Posing up in a rather seductive manner, Kylie, 22, hinted she was hanging out with daughter Stormi and rapper dad Travis with the caption: "Trolls and chill?" Young Stormi is known for obsession with the movie and franchise withe Travis surprising his daughter with a visit from a lifesize Poppy last Christmas. Kylie lifts her over size sweatshirt in the snap, showing off her taut tum as she arches her back, revealed suspiciously new lockdown locks. Fans rushed to comment on the snap which fast gathered more than five million likes. One wrote: "Just get back together already! Stop teasing us." Another gushed: "They are just the perfect couple!" While one fan simply wrote: "Is Kris Jenner gonna give Kylie a lockdown pregnancy?" Kylie and Travis are spending the lockdown time at her new California pad with best pal Stassie Karanikolaou. Kylie and Travis started dating following her split from Tyga in 2017 but broke up back in September. However, it was recently rumoured that they got back together at the start of the year - and their decision to isolate together has fuelled the gossip. A source told The Sun Online : "Kris doesn't want anyone jerking her daughters around - she's told Travis to put a ring on it and commit to a second baby. “Kylie would never put down rules like that, but she's made no secret about wanting another baby and commitment from him. “She really looks up to Kim and her marriage and big family with Kanye - it's her dream - so Kris is right - he needs to commit!"

Halle Berry, 53, Strikes A Fierce Pose In A Sheer Lingerie Outfit During A ‘Fitting Flashback’ — Pic

Is Halle Berry, 53, capable of looking less than flawless, like ever? The Oscar winner once again broke the internet when a photo of her rocking a very sexy outfit was posted on Friday, May 1. Fashion stylist Lindsay Flores heated up Instagram when she shared a pic of Halle striking a super fierce pose in a sheer lingerie ensemble. She appeared to go makeup free for the snap with her gorgeous brown locks cascading down both sides of her shoulders. “Ahhhhh the simpler times…,” Lindsay wrote as the caption with the hashtag #fittingflashback, more than likely referring to how things were before the worldwide coronavirus pandemic hit. Naturally the comments section were filled with endless compliments for Halle as fans couldn’t get over how “smoking hot” she looked. Halle has been one of those A-list stars that has been providing a great distraction for many of us who remain bored in self-isolation. She’s been doing this by uploading a variety of pics that highlight her ageless beauty to perfection. She, along with other actresses like Sarah Michelle Gellar, 44, and Niecy Nash, 50, excelled in the viral #pillowchallenge where people strap a pillow to their body with a belt as a cincher and nothing on underneath. The mother-of-two also got candid about her love life during an Instagram Live session with Lena Waithe, 35, in mid-April amid romance rumors between her and DJ D-Nice. “I’ve been pretty alone, by myself, going on three years now – decidedly so,” she first revealed before adding, ” I’ve decided to take time [for myself]… I’m going to spend time with me. And it’s been so great that I might stay like this.” She’s also been using her time in self-isolation to stay in tiptop shape. “I try to catch 10 minutes here and there with the goal of doing at least 30 total minutes of more formal exercise per day,” she explained during an interview with Women’s Health. “I piece together a bunch of little bursts of exercise (many of which I can use my full-body resistance loop and booty band for) to meet my 30-minutes-total goal. In the morning, I try to stretch and do a few rounds of abs moves, like sit-ups or planks, since I usually have some quiet time to myself while the kids eat breakfast.”
