Sheridan Smith and baby bump make lockdown TV debut as Mel in Isolation Stories

Sheridan Smith is to appear in the first episode of an emotional new television series called Isolation Stories. The actress, 38, is just weeks away from giving birth and will show off her blossoming belly when she stars as heavily pregnant character Mel. The new ITV series begins on May 4 and will document the experiences that families face during the coronavirus lockdown in 15-minute episodes throughout the week. On Monday, Sheridan becomes Mel, an expectant single mother that is isolating alone during the lockdown. In the emotional scenes, the downcast character speaks to her friends via video call but in fact doesn't mind being in isolation. During the convincing and tearful performance, the character struggles to come to term with her baby's imminent birth as well as going through the pregnancy without the married father of her child. In a snippet ahead of Monday's show, Sheridan is featured in different rooms of her home while exchanging virtual moments with pals. In one scene, Mel struggled to cast a smile as a friend is heard saying: "Melanie, let's see the bump." Another scene later in the short episode featured the character sobbing on the phone as she heard the words: "You're going to be a lovely mum." According to the Sheridan, she had had jumped at the opportunity to be involved with the miniseries because she felt it was important to reflect on what is going on. "I am heavily pregnant and have been isolating at home," she said. "So I jumped at the chance to make a drama about the massive drama going on all around us right now. The entire series has also been recorded in line with the country's strict isolation guidelines. During the filming of the show, produced by Oscar nominee Jeff Pope, directors would remotely instruct the actors on camera angles and scene composition. As well as Sheridan Smith, actor Robert Glenister, Eddie Marsan and Angela Griffin will also star in episodes during the week. Isolation Storiesairs at 9pm over four nights on ITV from tomorrow. D o you have a story to sell ? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 3303

3 May 11:07 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/sheridan-smith-baby-bump-make-21966126
Rating: 2.39
Pregnant Sheridan Smith weeps and cradles her baby bump in an emotional new trailer for ITV's hardhitting drama Isolation Stories inspired by the coronavirus pandemic

A heavily pregnant Sheridan Smith weeps and cradles her baby bump in an emotional new trailer for hardhitting ITV drama Isolation Stories.   The actress, 38, takes a starring role in Isolation Stories, a collection of four brand new stand-alone episodes born out of the novel coronavirus COVID-19 pandemic, which has so far claimed 227,638 lives across the world. Sheridan - who is expecting her first child with Jamie Horn - stars in the first of the four 15-minute episodes from BAFTA-winning executive producer Jeff Pope, which tells the stories of four different families, inspired by true people, coping through the crisis. In a new trailer for the drama, Sheridan, who plays Mel in the TV short, can be seen weeping as she video-calls family and discussing her upcoming motherhood.  In the trailer for the drama, which starts tomorrow night, Sheridan's character Mel can be seen video calling loved-ones from her home. Upon asking how many people are staying together, she is gutted to learn that there are 11 people isolating together, while she remains alone. Emotionally, she says: 'You've got 11 people there and you didn't even ask me.' And later, she is seen crying while speaking on the phone with someone about motherhood.  Director Jeff previously told how viewers will find her episode very emotional as the actress reveals her baby bump on camera for the first time.  He said: 'She had an enormous bump which makes an appearance at the end of the… She unveils this amazing… Then you see it – then she pulls it up, and it's a very emotional moment at the end.' Of Sheridan's decision to take the role while heavily pregnant herself, he added: 'She's in very good health. She's not got pre-eclampsia or any of those conditions that would be dangerous.'  Reflecting on the shoot, which took place in the home she shares with her insurance broker fiancé, Sheridan admitted it was left to him to set up the production equipment and handle the cameras while she filmed her scenes.  She explained: 'They dropped off lots of camera, lighting and sound equipment at the gate, all disinfected. Jamie was then talked through how it all worked. 'We had a crew of people on Zoom with us at all times during filming, explaining to Jamie where to place the cameras and lighting, he was amazing and isn’t in the industry so I was so proud of him.  'He was so good and turned out to be a natural cameraman. They were so impressed that they trusted him to do camera shots that are even tricky with a whole crew.  'I couldn’t help much with lifting, currently being so pregnant myself, so I was in charge of costume, make up, continuity etc.'  The actress admits she immediately said yes to the project after an initial approach from Oscar nominated writer and producer Pope, who laid the foundations for the series after watching wife Tina struggle with coronavirus symptoms.  She said: 'I am heavily pregnant and have been isolating at home so I jumped at the chance to make a drama about the massive drama going on all around us right now.  'I think it's really important to try and reflect what's happening to us whilst it is still.'  Six weeks of government mandated lockdown has also made Sheridan acutely aware of her good fortune in having Jamie, while character Mel faces an uncertain future without the father of her child, and without her family - who have abandoned her.  'I’m lucky I have the baby coming soon so it’s been a focus for me,' she said. 'I think it would be hard for people like the character I play in the drama, as she is on her own. And obviously it’s hard for all the families being kept apart at the minute, so I count myself lucky and we have adapted to this new “normal” for now.  'Clapping for the carers and watching all the beautiful situations happening have put things into perspective. It’s a terribly sad time for so many.  'But people coming together encouraging each other to stay strong has been a wonderful thing to witness.'  Robert and Tom Glenister, Eddie Marsan, Angela Griffin, Darren Boyd, David Threlfall, Michael Jibson, Leanne Best and Philip Jackson will also feature in the new four-part series.  Isolation Stories will air at 9pm for four consecutive nights on ITV1 from Monday May 4th.

Michelle Mone EXCLUSIVE: 'I was abusing myself' Lingerie tycoon likens being overweight to self-abuse as she reveals past battle with her size left her with depression

Michelle Mone has likened being overweight to self-abuse as she discussed her previous weight battle. The lingerie tycoon, 48, told how she was 'abusing myself' when she was at her heaviest, adding that her issue with her size left her feeling depressed. In a candid new interview, Michelle admitted that her weight left her feeling at an all-time low, but the it was the support of her parents that helped her on her weight-loss journey. In recent years, the star has shed eight stone and now wears a size 10. However, it was a tough journey to get where she is now, with Michelle confessing that in 2012 following her divorce from her first husband Michael, the pounds continued to creep on and she developed depression.  In an exclusive interview with the Daily Mail, she said: 'I was at my heaviest and had three children running around me and [I was] launching Ultimo around the world. I was getting bigger and bigger.  'I was abusing myself. I was on antidepressants from the doctor. It was awful.’  In her darkest hour, it was her parents Duncan, 70, and Isabel, 71, that made her see the light and realise she had to lose the weight 'for yourself'. She explained: 'My mum and dad used to be in tears. My dad wrote me heartfelt letters writing, “Please Michelle just do it for yourself I’m begging". While she said her mother begged: 'Enough of this nonsense and feeling sorry for yourself, you’ll have more to feel sorry for if you can’t put food on the table for your kids so ... make it work.’ The Scottish beauty went on to overhaul her lifestyle and dropped a whopping eight stone over the years.      Meanwhile, Michelle recently revealed she used to plaster unflattering photos of herself around her kitchen to motivate her to lose weight.  The entrepreneur told how she would stick up the snaps in order to try and stop herself from snacking after she previously reached a size 22. Speaking to The Mirror, she said: 'Weight loss is all about your mindset. For many years I put pictures of myself that I didn’t like in the kitchen, it put me off snacking.  'I’ve finally got to know my body and feel amazing in skinny jeans. I just need to be careful I don’t put it all back on now I’m hanging around the house all day.' Michelle likened her body to a business, saying she would not destroy her business so why would she destroy her body?  The businesswoman, who previously admitted posing for naked selfies to motivate her to lose the pounds, is now a size 10.        Michelle admitted she was 'devastated' to have to postpone her wedding to fiancé Doug Barrowman because of the coronavirus pandemic. Lady Mone, who was due to tie the knot this week, admitted she was not looking to get into a relationship when she first met billionaire Doug and was originally put off by how wealthy and powerful he is.     She said: 'We’d both invested in the same tech company and met at a dinner in 2016. I wasn’t ready for a relationship and said I wanted to just be friends. I was put off by how powerful and wealthy he was, because I’m independent.' However, Michelle was won over by Doug's 'sense of fun' while she also credits their respective children for getting them together.   The businesswoman and her other half had spent the last two years planning their special day, which will now take place in August, followed by a honeymoon to the far east.  Michelle said she and Doug have been having virtual parties with their friends on Zoom amid lockdown. The Ultimo founder explained that after 20 years of being burned out by work, she has finally got her work-life balance right.  Michelle recently revealed that she has hit her target weight and branded herself 'wedding ready' as she flaunted her slim size 10 frame on Instagram, after losing her final 11 pounds over the past few months.  She celebrated her weight-loss on social media, admitting that it's taken her seven years to reach her goal and explaining how she shed the pounds. Michelle uploaded a stunning - and very smiley - selfie, which displayed her trim frame down to her knees.   Alongside the snap, she wrote: 'After 7 years I've finally made my target weight!! There is only one way to do it...eat less, eat healthy & work out 1 hour a day... 'Finally lost my last 11ibs in the past few months. Size 10 & wedding ready' gushed the entrepreneur. In 2017 the Glaswegian businesswoman revealed that she said she had lost more than half a stone since becoming a vegetarian Michelle also previously revealed she underwent skin tightening with a celebrity cosmetic medic after shedding the pounds. It comes after Michelle revealed she's been in secret talks to join Dragons' Den. The underwear tycoon admitted she turned down appearing on the show several times, but hinted she would be open to appearing on the series to 'inspire people' following the COVID-19 pandemic. Michelle became one of the UK's top businesswomen after founding underwear brand Ultimo in 1996, and is thought to be worth around £50 million. Speaking to The Sun, Michelle said she had been approached to appear on Dragons' Den several times, and had turned it down despite numerous big money offers. She said: 'In the past, I've been offered Dragons' Den and I've turned it down due to business commitments. 'But I just feel that after this whole coronavirus crisis is over, we need to be lifted up as individuals — we need to feel there is a real purpose in life and what we're going to do with our lives. 'I might be open to something that might help to give people inspiration.' Dragons' Den sees budding entrepreneurs pitch their products to a panel of businessmen and women who are looking to invest their millions in return for a percentage of their business. The current lineup consists of Peter Jones, 54, plus long-serving Deborah Meaden, 61, Sara Davies, 35, Tej Lalvani, 45, and Touker Suleyman, 66.

Rating: 4.11
Katie Price confesses she's been 'off the rails for more than ten years' and 'a mess'

Katie Price has admitted she has been slowly going off the rails for just over ten years, confessing she has been "a mess" at times. Yummy mummy Katie, 41, who has publicly battled drink and drug problems, kidnap attempts, marriage splits and cancer, confessed she knows she will need therapy for life after her hellish decade. Fans of the mum-of-five won't be able to help date her breakdown timeline to her very public split from first husband Peter Andre in 2009, they divorced in September that year. Now brunette Katie, who went on to marry cage fighter Alex Reid in 2010 which ended in less than a year, and sex cheat Kieran Hayler in 2013, says she is finally ready to face her demons as she films her Quest Red TV show. In a clip released on Saturday night, the star confesses: "I've been slowly going off the rails for just over ten years at times I have been a mess. "Four weeks in hospital and some intensive therapy that will continue for the rest of my life. I've been to hell and back but I am starting to feel like me again." Katie has always said she didn't want to split from first husband Pete, who went on to marry doctor Emily MacDonagh and have two children, Theo and Amelia. She said she would always feel regrets over her split with her first husband, speaking last year Katie confessed: "And with Pete, I probably wouldn’t have done so much stuff in the media because I reckon we still would be together if certain people hadn’t been involved 100%." As early as this year Katie's ex caretaker Charlie Farthing painted a bleak picture of Katie's life in her old 11 bedroom pile - revealing piles of dog poo everywhere, the stench of cat pee from her hairless moggy and gales whipping through the mansion after son Harvey smashed in windows. But Charlie, who worked for the mum of five for four months, also worryingly tells how the star would come stumbling home after club nights with cash spilling out of her bag. And, even more concerning, was the discovery of empty packets of drugs under a solitary mattress Katie slept on in the annexe of her West Sussex home. Charlie told The Sun : “I was tidying up the annexe and I was moving the bed about and there were a couple of little bags, empty wraps that looked like they used to have coke in them so I suspected she’d used them at some point. “I didn’t see her drink that much in the house, or take drugs, but when she came back from nights out she was clearly off her head, so I knew she was on something.”

Entertainment
Say namaste to quarantine's queen of yoga: Forget Joe Wicks! With free classes to calm anxiety, ease loneliness and even beat the lockdown lard ADRIENE MISHLER has got over a million Brits hooked

3 May 21:02 • 2 articles
Weight: 2.06
Importance: 2.06
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 21:02
Average US: 21.505
Weighted average US: 28.398493931070252
Average GB: 5.489999999999999
Weighted average GB: 7.5199066217781105
Average IN: 2.2249999999999996
Weighted average IN: 3.033083846249248

Say namaste to quarantine's queen of yoga: Forget Joe Wicks! With free classes to calm anxiety, ease loneliness and even beat the lockdown lard ADRIENE MISHLER has got over a million Brits hooked

Take a deep breath, put your hands together and say namaste to Adriene Mishler, the queen of quarantine yoga. Joe Wicks may have conquered the hearts of pent-up five-year-olds but, for midlife women, the 35-year-old instructor reigns supreme. As thousands of us take up at-home classes to keep calm and exercise inflexible bodies, YouTube's biggest yoga guru (7.2 million subscribers including 1.1 million Brits) is among the 500 YouTube stars who have seen the biggest increases in their subscriber base over the past four weeks. She favours a mind and body practice which has its roots in ancient Indian philosophy. But I'd argue there are two things that have really got us hooked. First, she advocates 'yoga quickies'—classes timed to last between five and 45 minutes. She believes a little daily yoga practice goes a long way and not many of us want those intimidating hour-long classes where we work up a sweat and try to master handstands. Secondly, she offers sessions targeted at the mood swings many people are experiencing during lockdown. There's yoga for anxiety, or for when you're angry or suffering. There is also yoga for focus and productivity, relationships and gratitude. And even, controversially, yoga for weight loss. 'It was always my dream to see yoga being practised as a normal thing in households, a tool that we could use — like opening a medicine cabinet,' says Adriene, who has gained a million more followers during lockdown. 'It's unfortunate that it's happening under these circumstances, but I'm seeing it now.' Adriene is talking to me via FaceTime from her home in Austin, Texas, where her yoga videos are filmed. She lives alone with her dog Benji, who features in her broadcasts and is humorously referred to as her 'assistant'. 'I've been at home for a long time and I'm starting to feel this push-pull,' she says. 'One minute I'm celebrating being alone because it's a bit of a respite, and the next I have discomfort and the feeling of being lonely. I'm trying to find the balance and centre in this.' She grew up in a theatrical family — her parents were actors — and Adriene believed she, too, was destined for a life in theatre or films. She would practice yoga as a warm-up during rehearsals for dance shows and amateur dramatics, but a class she took at the age of 17 was her lightbulb moment. 'It was the first time I'd done yoga just for me, with no ulterior motive,' she recalls. 'I had this moment of pure joy. It was potent and I wanted everyone to feel this.' Adriene undertook the hundreds of hours it takes to become a yoga teacher and, as an actor, began what she calls 'the grind of the starving middle-class artist'. 'It was a hand-to-mouth way of living,' she says. 'I'd get up and teach yoga, then do a drama class with children, then nanny. 'I'd go and pick children up from school and do homework and dinner and fold other people's laundry, then drive through traffic and go to rehearsal, then have a glass of wine with my mates to decompress. I'd get up the next day and do it all again. I did that until I was 26. 'On Saturdays I'd teach children's yoga, and the next day I'd work the check-in table for the adult yoga class so I could take it for free. 'Even a few years into doing Yoga With Adriene on YouTube, I was still mopping floors in studios in exchange for free classes. That's a huge piece of this story, because I couldn't afford to do regular yoga classes, and I thought there were probably others who couldn't afford it as well.' Adriene, in a crumpled beige sweater with her hair tied back and no make-up, is talking to me from her home office and we both hear the pitter-patter of paws as Benji appears. I get a glimpse of a nose and two grey ears. 'He's like: 'I know you're talking about me,' ' laughs Adriene. The five-year-old dog jumps up on the day bed behind Adriene, then changes his mind and saunters out. 'I don't know what I did to deserve this friendship,' Adriene says. She met her business partner Chris Sharpe on the set of a film, and they decided to set up Yoga With Adriene on YouTube, posting the first videos in 2012. 'There wasn't much yoga online at that time, it was very much 'the guru passes it to the people',' she says. 'Going into this project, I had a fear of disrespecting yoga. I wanted my teachers to be proud of me.' For this reason, she says, the initial videos concentrated on single positions. 'The first video I ever uploaded was Sukhasana, the seated, cross-legged pose. I do feel proud that that first video is entirely about learning to sit — which is relevant big-time now, all over the world.' A huge 16 per cent of her subscribers are British. She says they found her online and that she met others when she did yoga roadshows in Manchester and London in 2016 and 2018. 'I did classes in an old boxing gym in London's Bethnal Green and we had another with about 2,400 people in Alexandra Palace,' she remembers. 'I've got a lot of friends in the UK and they say people like Yoga With Adriene because there's a bit of self-deprecating humour going on, like little silly jokes about creaky floors.' One reason for her success is that she seems so unpretentious. Having recently taken some of her classes, I can testify that she comes across as authoritative, with a calm presence. It feels like exercising with a friend because she is so warm. With other virtual yoga classes, I've tied myself in knots trying to look at the teacher and do the positions simultaneously. With Adriene I rarely had to look at the screen because you can achieve the poses mostly just by listening to her. I like the 'shopping list' aspect of her videos, too. During the current health crisis there are days when people feel OK and others when they feel anxious. There are classes to suit all our many moods. She nods. 'A lot of people think you have to do it one way — like 'I'm an ashtanga yogi' or 'I only do vinyasa'. But that, for me, has never made sense. We are not the same people from day to day spiritually, mentally and physically. That's why I love the mantra 'find what feels good'. 'Everything isn't going to feel good all the time, but it's about your willingness to stay curious and be present with what you're feeling today.' Her yoga for beginners workout has 28 million views, so she seems to have found a way of teaching that people can relate to. 'I wouldn't be at the place I am now if I hadn't done the studies and tried everything from bikram to binyasa,' she says, naming two yoga disciplines. But, she adds: 'I'm influenced by an acting training called the Suzuki Method and its sister training called The Viewpoints. 'It's about being present in one moment and allowing it to flow to the next and about breath control and voice, so there's a lot of crossover.' I was surprised to see that she broadcasts yoga videos for weight loss — a big claim. Intense styles of yoga help you burn the most calories, but restorative yoga is not especially physical and I would not expect to lose weight with it. Her business partner suggested the weight-loss series to help the videos rise through search rankings, I discover. 'I don't dread this question like I used to,' Adriene says. 'I'm grateful for the chance to speak. 'I used to say to my team , 'let's take this out as we're at the point where we don't need it. We've got millions of subscribers'. 'But, looking at the numbers, the difference between a video that says 'weight-loss' versus anything else is unbelievable. What it tells me is there are many people who want to lose weight and they're struggling. Maybe they could be supported more by the practice I'm sharing. 'If I were to remove those videos, all the people searching for yoga for weight loss are going to find videos that might not make them feel so supported. I've seen those videos and I don't think they're healthy.' Her numbers in this area are staggering. There are 24 videos in the weight-loss series and the top four are her fat-burning workout (8.9 million), her total body workout (3.1 million), her health energy flow workout (3.3 million) and hips and abs (3.6 million). 'I keep them up so people can find us and hear that it's OK to create some changes, but you have to know why. What's the point of losing weight or having toned muscles if you're still looking in the mirror and you don't love who you see?' These days, she makes money through advertising revenue on YouTube and has a growing number of subscribers who pay $9.99 a month (around £8), which helps subsidise her 600 free videos. She is also writing a book and developing a travel show. When not working, she also sees her boyfriend regularly — lockdown rules in Texas are not as stringent as in other parts of the U.S. He built a software company, then sold it and is now a writer. They only met six months ago but she says happily: 'He's a doll, I'm very lucky.' For those of us without Adriene's years of practice (and flexibility) but perhaps hoping to make yoga a habit during lockdown, she is typically encouraging. You can even practise it in your pyjamas, Adriene points out — the hardest part of the practise is showing up. 'I also think it's OK to have fun during these difficult times,' she says. 'There's yoga for loneliness if you need it, but it's also OK to have fun on that mat or towel and to welcome the light moments. They can be really healing.' 

3 May 21:02 • Mail Online • https://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-8282827/Forget-Joe-Wicks-ADRIENE-MISHLER-got-million-Brits-hooked.html?ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490&ito=1490
Rating: 4.11
Want that K-pop idol body? Follow these workouts

MANILA, Philippines – K-pop stars impress their fans not only with their spot-on dancing and sensational singing but also with their fit bodies. Here are some workouts that idols do to stay in shape: Momo of TWICE The Japanese is not just known for being one of the best dancers among K-pop idols, she is also popular for her toned abs. Momo recommends doing 50 plank hip dips 3 times a day with sit-ups on the side. Although Momo loves eating – with her motto being "If I work hard, I can eat delicious things" – she compensates for her huge appetite by remaining fit. Jungkook of BTS For the most in-demand boy group in the world, BTS always needs to be in top shape to fulfill all of its commitments. Jungkook, for example, follows a rigorous exercise routine. The maknae of the seven-member act does squats, push-ups, jump squats, pike push-ups, planks, mountain climbers, burpees, crunches, leg raises, and Superman exercises in his workout. Girls' Generation From Taeyeon to Tiffany to Seohyun, Girls' Generation is considered body goals. Members of SNSD were known for having slim legs, which is largely thanks to their 5:3:2 exercise that is said to result in the "golden ratio" of thigh, calf, and shin. The 5:3:2 leg workout includes jumping jacks, high knees, and leg kicks. SEVENTEEN Working out can be challenging, so doing it with a partner might make the task a little less burdensome. Just look at SEVENTEEN members DK and Seungkwan, who bond through exercising at their own dorm. The two vocalists do planks, side planks, mountain climbers, burpees, push-ups, crunches, and jogging. – Rappler.com

2 May 14:50 • Rappler • https://www.rappler.com/sports/by-sport/other-sports/259739-k-pop-workouts-to-achieve-idol-body
Rating: 1.64
Entertainment
Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr ‘unheard’ track going under the hammer

3 May 23:17 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.76
Importance: 2.06
Age penalty: 0.85
Best date: 3 May 08:53
Average US: 22.7
Weighted average US: 35.48787654498587
Average GB: 21.299999999999997
Weighted average GB: 11.709092591260598
Average IN: 8.45
Weighted average IN: 4.6914011506291535

Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr ‘unheard’ track going under the hammer

An unheard track by Sir Paul McCartney and Sir Ringo Starr recorded after the Beatles split is heading for auction. Angel In Disguise could be the only song co-written exclusively by the band’s former bassist and drummer, according to auctioneers. The ex-Beatles recorded the demo for Sir Ringo’s 1992 solo album Time Takes Time but it did not make the cut. Former Radio Luxembourg DJ Tony Prince is selling the cassette, which is expected to fetch up to £20,000. He was asked to find artists to record alternative versions of Angel In Disguise in the 1990s, after Sir Ringo rejected the track. The song has never been heard publicly. Auctioneer Paul Fairweather said: “It’s fantastic to be able to bring to the market a previously unheard and unreleased track… “We think the track certainly had enough about it to be included in the album and I am sure if Paul was to release this himself it would certainly prove a hit with fans.” The cassette contains two versions of the track – a rough demo with Sir Paul  on vocals and a fuller ‘mixed’ version with musicians and backing vocals and Sir Ringo singing. Another Sir Ringo demo, Everyone Wins, which was also shelved but later released on a compilation recording, is also included on the tape. The tape, with other memorabilia, will go under the hammer at Omega Auctions’ online sale on May 19, with 25% of proceeds donated to the NHS Charities Together Covid-19 Urgent Appeal.

3 May 23:17 • Express & Star • https://www.expressandstar.com/entertainment/showbiz/2020/05/03/paul-mccartney-and-ringo-starr-unheard-track-going-under-the-hammer/
Rating: 0.30
Sir Paul McCartney's unreleased collaboration with former Beatles bandmate Sir Ringo Starr expected to fetch up to £20,000 after heading to auction

An unheard track by Sir Paul McCartney and Sir Ringo Starr recorded after the Beatles split is heading for auction. Angel In Disguise could be the only song co-written exclusively by the band's former bassist and drummer, according to auctioneers. The ex-Beatles recorded the demo for Sir Ringo's 1992 solo album Time Takes Time but it did not make the cut. Former Radio Luxembourg DJ Tony Prince is selling the cassette, which is expected to fetch up to £20,000. He was asked to find artists to record alternative versions of Angel In Disguise in the 1990s, after Sir Ringo rejected the track. The song has never been heard publicly. Auctioneer Paul Fairweather said: 'It's fantastic to be able to bring to the market a previously unheard and unreleased track... 'We think the track certainly had enough about it to be included in the album and I am sure if Paul was to release this himself it would certainly prove a hit with fans.' The cassette contains two versions of the track - a rough demo with Sir Paul on vocals and a fuller 'mixed' version with musicians and backing vocals and Sir Ringo singing. Another Sir Ringo demo, Everyone Wins, which was also shelved but later released on a compilation recording, is also included on the tape. The tape, with other memorabilia, will go under the hammer at Omega Auctions' online sale on May 19, with 25% of proceeds donated to the NHS Charities Together Covid-19 Urgent Appeal. The Beatles announced their split in 1970, shortly before the release of their twelfth studio album, Let It Be. Speaking on SiriusXM's The Howard Stern Show in March, Sir Paul spoke candidly about the end of the world's most successful group.  When asked why he didn't keep the band together after Lennon announced his departure, he said:  'When families break up, it's to do with the emotion and the emotional pain. 'You can't just think of a smart idea like that at the time. You're hurting too much so it wasn't going to happen.'

3 May 08:53 • Mail Online • https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-8281819/Sir-Paul-McCartneys-collaboration-former-Sir-Ringo-Starr-expected-fetch-20-000.html?ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490&ito=1490
Rating: 4.11

Coronavirus: UK neighbours perform bhangra while maintaining social distance, video goes viral

3 May 10:15 • 2 articles

Average GB: 0.15
Weighted average GB: 0.27439056302312076
Average IN: 8.5
Weighted average IN: 15.548798571310178

Coronavirus: UK neighbours perform bhangra while maintaining social distance, video goes viral

Around the world, people are isolating and practising social distancing, but it is not stopping them from having fun and spreading cheer, like a group of neighbours in a UK locality who decided to perform bhangra. A video is doing rounds across social media platforms and is warming hearts online. While social distancing amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, the group of people were seen performing basic steps of the Indian folk dance outside their homes. Bhangra is a type of traditional dance from the Indian subcontinent, originating in the Majha area of Punjab. Reportedly, the video was first shared by Twitter user Eeshar Singh, @shergillj99, who is part of the clip. News magazine India Today reported that Singh started dancing and others joined in, imitating his poses from a distance. According to Singh's Facebook bio, it seems that the clip is from Leeds, UK. The group performed to the Punjabi song, ‘Veervaar’ from the movie 'Sardaar Ji' by the artist Diljit Dosanjh. “Mum got me dancing for the street,” he wrote online sharing the clip. Performers were also seen playing the dhol in the clip. The dancing skills have impressed many online, including singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh the original artist in the film, who retweeted the video online. Many also appreciated that people from different cultural backgrounds joined in and imitated the moves. Twitter user @lxzettexo wrote: "It warmed my heart seeing other people of other cultures join. Thanks Tweep @jmanderuk posted: "Love this, wish their was more of this community spirit and cross culture happiness in the world." User @OneFurrowedBrow could not get enough of the performance: "Why is this only 45 seconds short?"

3 May 10:15 • Gulf News • https://gulfnews.com/world/europe/coronavirus-uk-neighbours-perform-bhangra-while-maintaining-social-distance-video-goes-viral-1.1588501049639
Rating: 3.21
People performing bhangra in UK neighbourhood while maintaining social distance is a hit online

While social distancing has become the order of the day amid the Covid-19pandemic, people are finding new ways to show they are all in this together and can have some fun too. Now, too keep up the spirits amid the global health crisis, people in a neighbourhood in the United Kingdom were seen performing bhangra. The video is doing round across social media sites and is warming hearts online. In the video posted on Twitter, Eeshar Singh can be seen doing some basic steps of the folk dance outside his home and others joined in, imitating his poses from a distance. Grooving to peppy Punjani song, ‘Veervaar’ from Sardaarji people are seeing shaking a leg on the streets. “Mum got me dancing for the street,” the artist wrote online sharing the clip. And if that wasn’t enough, the woman made her son play the dhol as well to set the mood and vibe right along the desi song. The cool ritual impressed many online, including singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh the original artiste in the film, who retweeted the video online. Last month, a video of people dancing in the UK also went viral.

2 May 14:27 • The Indian Express • https://indianexpress.com/article/trending/viral-videos-trending/people-doing-bhangra-in-uk-neighbourhood-while-maintaining-social-distance-is-a-hit-online-6390612/
Rating: 0.30
Entertainment
Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

3 May 14:00 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.52
Importance: 1.53
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 14:00
Average US: 3.55
Weighted average US: 3.000883017848773
Average GB: 0.0
Weighted average GB: 0.0
Average IN: 1.9
Weighted average IN: 1.7242825657116072

Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age have selected five emerging culture critics after receiving funding from the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for Journalism and Ideas. The grant will enable up to 100 extra pieces of critical writing across literature, visual arts and theatre in 2020. The books critics are Bec Kavanagh and Jack Callil, who will write for both mastheads. The visual arts critics are Chloe Wolifson (Sydney) and Tiarney Miekus (Melbourne), while Cassie Tongue will cover theatre for the Herald. While the present coronavirus-induced shutdown has decimated much of the arts and culture industry and forced theatres and art galleries to close, it provides the writers with an opportunity to produce other critical pieces and highlight areas of innovation during this once-in-a-generation crisis. Kavanagh is a Melbourne-based writer who has been published in The Australian and Meanjin. "I'm looking forward to sinking my teeth into some great new stories, and writing into a space that values the contributions of writers and the arts – particularly at this time," she said. Callil is digital editor at the Australian Book Review and a proofreader at Meanjin. "Having the opportunity to write about Australia’s vibrant and diverse literary community is an exceptional privilege," he said. Wolifson has previously written for the Herald and The Guardian and has a monthly column in Art Monthly Australasia. "It's always my hope that a review I've written encourages readers to go and view the exhibition themselves and engage with the work. I'm excited for this opportunity to start more conversations about Australian contemporary art," she said. Miekus is a Melbourne-based writer and editor of Art Guide Australia. She has a strong interest in contemporary art and plays in a post-punk band. "It's both humbling and exciting to be a contributing voice on visual arts, and to have the space, time and support to think intently and purposefully on visual art," she said. Tongue has had regular theatre reviews published in Time Out and The Guardian. "I'm looking forward to writing about new Australian performance as it happens: exploring new trends, engaging deeply with what our artists have to say, and giving thoughtful responses to the work of theatre-makers and performers who might otherwise miss out on coverage," she said. Copyright Agency chief executive Adam Suckling said the five new critics will bring "important new voices to the landscape of arts criticism and review in Australia". "The current crisis has shown just how fragile and important Australian writing and visual arts practice is," Mr Suckling said. "While things are very grim for creators at the moment, the new critics will look at ways of covering Australian creativity during this terrible crisis. But they will also be in place for when, and I hope this is very soon, it is safe for Australian audiences to return to physical book launches, plays and shows at galleries." Matthew Burgess, culture editor at the Herald and The Age, said he was "thrilled" to welcome the five new critics to the mastheads after an impressive number of applications. "It is an exciting opportunity for our readers to gain fresh perspectives in visual arts, stage and books criticism," he said. "Our thanks to the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for supporting this important project."

3 May 14:00 • The Age • https://www.theage.com.au/culture/books/emerging-culture-critics-announced-for-the-herald-and-the-age-20200429-p54odf.html?ref=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_source=rss_feed
Rating: 2.20

The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age have selected five emerging culture critics after receiving funding from the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for Journalism and Ideas. The Apprentice star Lottie Lion apologises after Lord Sugar 'racist' comments

3 May 15:58 • 2 articles

Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

The Apprentice star Lottie Lion apologises after Lord Sugar 'racist' comments

The Apprentice has had its fair share of big personalities, but you'd be hard pressed to find one who could outmatch the controversial Lottie Lion. Lottie, who's only 20 years old, made her mark among last year's contenders and had accusations of racism levelled against her. Now she's found herself in hot water again after her impression of Venezuelan born team mate Jemelin Artigas stoked some considerable backlash. Jemelin, who's clashed with Lottie before, shared a video sent to her on her own Twitter, in which Lottie and contestant Ryan-Mark Parson take part in an Instagram Live. Lottie mocks Jemelin's accent while Ryan-Mark laughs along. She added, in her own voice: "It's like, darling, we all started from nothing - I started from nothing." Lottie went on to say: "If we're going to talk about f**king racists, let's talk about Lord Sugar! "He's an actual racist!" Mirror Online have gone to Lord Sugar's rep for comment. Lottie and Ryan-Mark have since apologised over her impersonation, telling MailOnline : "We impersonated various candidates from The Apprentice on our Instagram Live on Friday. "We are aware one candidate has taken offence and can only apologise." On social media she had previously defended her comments as "light entertainment" rather than anything meant to hurt. "Doing these impressions of The Apprentice candidates last night was meant to be some light entertainment for my fans during these difficult times ," she tweeted. "I am aware that an individual HAS taken offence, and I can only apologise." Nor has Jemelin been silent on the matter, sharing a string of tweets explaining her position. She branded Lottie "the biggest racist" and accused the pair of being "pathetic" after Lottie issued her apology tweet. However, she retweeted Ryan-Mark's apology and wrote: "I will always appreciate people taking responsibility so thank you @ryanmarkparsons and even though I know some not so nice things have been said. "I appreciate you apologising so thank you."

3 May 15:58 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/apprentice-star-lottie-lion-apologises-21967335
Rating: 2.39
The Apprentice star Lottie Lion apologises after Lord Sugar 'racist' comments

The Apprentice has had its fair share of big personalities, but you'd be hard pressed to find one who could outmatch the controversial Lottie Lion. Lottie and Ryan-Mark have since apologised over her impersonation, telling MailOnline : "We impersonated various candidates from The Apprentice on our Instagram Live on Friday. "We are aware one candidate has taken offence and can only apologise." On social media she had previously defended her comments as "light entertainment" rather than anything meant to hurt. She branded Lottie "the biggest racist" and accused the pair of being "pathetic" after Lottie issued her apology tweet. However, she retweeted Ryan-Mark's apology and wrote: "I will always appreciate people taking responsibility so thank you @ryanmarkparsons and even though I know some not so nice things have been said. "I appreciate you apologising so thank you."

Madonna attends birthday party after testing positive for coronavirus antibodies

3 May 17:17 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48

Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

Madonna attends birthday party after testing positive for coronavirus antibodies

Madonna made sure she didn't miss out on a friend's birthday party, despite recently testing positive for coronavirus antibodies. The Like A Virgin singer, 61, attended the bash in person and even hugged and presented her pal Steven Klein with a cake to mark his 55th birthday. No one at the birthday bash was wearing any protective gear like face masks, despite the worldwide coronavirus crisis. Madonna's positive test means she has recently been in contact with Covid-19. Klein's birthday party was livestreamed on the video chatting app Zoom meaning guests could attend it virtually, but defiant Madge was there in person. One of the people who attended shared a video of Madonna hugging Klein. They captioned the post: "M made an appearance at Steven Klein's Virtual Birthday Party - such a blast!! "M called his Bday cake a Covid Cake. "She's too f**king cute!!! We are living in some crazy tiMes! "But trying to make the most of it, and still have soMe fun!!! [sic]" Mirror Online has contacted Madonna's reps for comment. Madonna took to Instagram to reveal she'd tested positive for the coronavirus antibodies earlier this week. "Took a test the other day, and I found out that I have the antibodies," she said. "So tomorrow, I'm just going to go for a long drive in the car… and I'm going to breathe in the COVID-19 air. "Yep. I hope the sun is shining."

3 May 17:17 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/madonna-attends-birthday-party-after-21967612

The Chase fans in disbelief over contestant's likeness to Emmerdale legend

3 May 21:30 • 2 articles

Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75

The Chase fans in disbelief over contestant's likeness to Emmerdale legend

Viewers tuning into The Chase's family special on Sunday, called The Family Chase, were left stunned by one contestant. Those watching the ITV gameshow dubbed her a lookalike of a former Emmerdale legend. Viewers thought contestant Paula looked so much like the character in particular, that they began calling her by said character's name. Emmerdale fans were quick to spot she looked remarkably like Val Pollard. Val was married to Eric Pollard in the Dales, before her tragic death in 2015 during the helicopter stunt. She was played by actress Charlie Hardwick since 2004. As Paula appeared on The Chase on Sunday, fans spotted the huge resemblance between her and the actress who played Val. From the hair colour to the matching style, and even the Geordie accent, fans couldn't believe their eyes. One viewer said: "Seat 2  #TheChase," with an image of Val leading to many others agreeing. Another fan agreed: "Val up now! #TheChase." A third said: "Now it's Val from Emmerdale  #Thefamilychase." Unfortunately, like her sister who went before her, Paula was caught by the Chaser, Paul Sinha, and sent home. As her departure aired, one fan tweeted: "That was too f***ing easy. Now do one back to the Woolpack, Val." A second fan hoped she might return for the final chase, and said: "Go low & bring Val back oot!" Unfortunately, it was just Hannah left to play in the final round and she and the family did not win the cash prize. The Chase airs weeknights at 5pm on ITV.

3 May 21:30 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/chase-fans-disbelief-over-contestants-21968182
Rating: 2.39
The Chase fans in disbelief over contestant's likeness to Emmerdale legend

Viewers tuning into The Chase's family special on Sunday, called The Family Chase, were left stunned by one contestant. Those watching the ITV gameshow dubbed her a lookalike of a former Emmerdale legend. Viewers thought contestant Paula looked so much like the character in particular, that they began calling her by said character's name. Emmerdale fans were quick to spot she looked remarkably like Val Pollard. Val was married to Eric Pollard in the Dales, before her tragic death in 2015 during the helicopter stunt. She was played by actress Charlie Hardwick since 2004. As Paula appeared on The Chase on Sunday, fans spotted the huge resemblance between her and the actress who played Val. From the hair colour to the matching style, and even the Geordie accent, fans couldn't believe their eyes. One viewer said: "Seat 2  #TheChase," with an image of Val leading to many others agreeing. Another fan agreed: "Val up now! #TheChase." A third said: "Now it's Val from Emmerdale  #Thefamilychase." Unfortunately, like her sister who went before her, Paula was caught by the Chaser, Paul Sinha, and sent home. As her departure aired, one fan tweeted: "That was too f***ing easy. Now do one back to the Woolpack, Val." A second fan hoped she might return for the final chase, and said: "Go low & bring Val back oot!" Unfortunately, it was just Hannah left to play in the final round and she and the family did not win the cash prize. The Chase airs weeknights at 5pm on ITV.

3 May 21:30 • Irish Mirror • https://www.irishmirror.ie/tv/chase-fans-disbelief-over-contestants-21968402
Rating: 0.56
Entertainment
Who will take Holly Willoughby's spot on Celebrity Juice?

3 May 21:41 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 21:41
Average US: 16.25
Weighted average US: 18.016429974370464
Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

Who will take Holly Willoughby's spot on Celebrity Juice?

Now that Holly Willoughby had opted to leave Celebrity Juice, the show needs a new team captain. With no official word on who will fill Holly's shoes, fans are busy speculating as to who will be baring the brunt of Keith Lemon's most outrageous gags. Holly did just that for 12 years, having been a team captain since the show got off the ground way back in 2008 - but who will take her place? The biggest theories are below... The Corrie and Our Girl star is probably the front runner right now. Both Michelle and hunky husband Mark Wright have made appearances on the show, and both were a hit with fans. Bookies Ladbrokes are backing her too, a spokesman saying: "Michelle Keegan's no stranger to Celebrity Juice and she could soon become a permanent fixture if the latest odds are anything to go by." She's also hung up her helmet on Our Girl, so she could have some space open in her diary... Gogglebox original Scarlett Moffatt has also been floated by fans. She's also appeared on the show, and proved a popular panellist. Ladbrokes reckon she's a solid bet, and fans know from Gogglebox she's got the comedy chops to stand her own ground. Inbetweeners star Emily went through a surge in popularity after her I'm A Celebrity stint in 2018. She's since become an ITV staple, with This Morning appearances and a hosting gig on I'm A Celebrity: Extra Camp. Emily's appeared fairly recently on Celebrity Juice, and sent Keith into overdrive by sharing a kiss with Spice Girl Mel B. Kelly and Keith must be close mates by now - she's turned up on the show, and even starred in his film, aptly named Keith Lemon: The Movie. She's already got her radio show so her diary's pretty busy, but if her recent Bake Off stint proved anything it's that she can keep fans entertained. Her rapport with pal Keith is already well established in fans' minds, so she won't take much introduction. The Italian chef is another ITV staple, and no stranger to speaking his mind. During his This Morning appearances, when he cooks with Holly and Phillip Schofield, he's become legendary for his brutal honesty and scathing criticism. He's been busy with Gordon Ramsay and Fred Sirieix on their show Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip, so it's uncertain how much freedom he'll have. He'd certainly clash with Keith...

3 May 21:41 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/who-take-holly-willoughbys-spot-21968307
Rating: 2.39

Entertainment
Gogglebox viewers rank the stars with one group taking nearly 40% of the vote

3 May 15:05 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 15:05
Average US: 16.25
Weighted average US: 18.016429974370464
Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

Gogglebox viewers rank the stars with one group taking nearly 40% of the vote

Gogglebox has become beloved by millions, and everyone has their favourites. Fans recently took part in a poll that allowed them to put forward which of the 11 groups they reckoned deserved the honour of the top spot. The poll, conducted by The Liverpool Echo, asked fans to order the stars based on how much they make them laugh - with one even stealing 39% of the vote. Below are all 11 groups, ranked... London family the Vens joined the show quite late, during season 11 in 2018. Marcus, girlfriend Mica, and her two daughters Sachelle and Shuggy have become renowned for their bubbly personalities, fits of laughter, and on point honesty. Mica provided a priceless fan favourite moment as they sat down to watch Victoria Coren Mitchell's notoriously tricky Only Connect, laughing: "This show isn't for the hood, man." Dad Andrew, mum Carolyne and son Louis have been Gogglebox fixtures since the show first kicked off. Their numbers have fluctuated, as twin sisters Alex and Catheryne seem to come and go as well. The family have become best known for Andrew's uncompromising and often scathing wit, as he kicks back in that enormous armchair. Brighton hairdresser Stephen first appeared on the show alongside then boyfriend Chris, before the pair went their separate ways. He's since been joined by husband Daniel, as well as mum Pat for a stint. Stephen is responsible for one of the most iconic Gogglebox moments. As he and Chris watched the news, the latter observed: "We all like a bad boy, don't we?" A stunned Stephen looks around and answers: "Not a f**king terrorist though, Chris!" Dave and Shirley have been married for a staggering 40 years, filming the show from their home in Wales. Joining the show in 2015, fans have learned that the pair have a genuine deep love for each other - but that won't stop them having a bicker now and again. Ellie and Izzi stirred the pot recently when they made their feelings very clear about Boris Johnson. Still, the Yorkshire sisters are mostly a light hearted pair, most often obsessing over food. When they first put their names down for the show, they reckoned people wouldn't be interested in what they had to say. The poll begs to differ... Bristol besties Mary and Marina are completely unfiltered and they hold nothing back. Both in their 80s, they film from a retirement home and have won legions of fans as their conversations go off on tangents. Dad Sid and sons Baasit and Umar are well known for their no nonsense slams and quick wit. The core three are often joined by other family members, like sister Raza and their mum. The family of four have carved out a place as firm fan favourites, as have their Rottweilers. The dogs can be seen having a nose about the place and often trying to swipe a biscuit or two when they think the family won't notice. In fact, their snack collection has become the stuff of Gogglebox legend, with fans not convinced they ever eat them themselves. Probably the quirkiest couple on the list, Giles and Mary will always have a place in fans' hearts. The posh duo's home is instantly memorable, as are their lengthy and eloquent rants about whatever they're watching. Coming in second place with 23% of the vote, brother and sister Pete and Sophie were string contenders for the top spot despite only arriving on the show in 2018. The Blackpool pair have become renowned for mocking each other as much as they do the telly, so it's no surprise they've proved a hit with fans. Taking the top spot are the iconic, the legendary, the one and only Jenny and Lee. The caravan-based pair from Hull swept up a whopping 39% of the vote, landing them as the firm victors. They first met when Jenny was a landlady and Lee was a pub regular, and have since struck up the sweetest - and funniest friendship. Joining in 2014, it's not difficult to see why they've managed to place themselves at the top of the list.

3 May 15:05 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/gogglebox-viewers-rank-stars-one-21967130
Rating: 2.39

Mystery over Rob Kardashian and stunning British influencer Kenza Boutrif's new friendship

3 May 13:56 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 13:56
Average US: 16.25
Weighted average US: 18.016429974370464
Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

Mystery over Rob Kardashian and stunning British influencer Kenza Boutrif's new friendship

Rob Kardashian has just added stunning British model and influencer Kenza Boutrif to his Instagram following, taking the total up to 21. The 33-year-old reality star set tongues wagging on social media after giving the UK-based model and social media star a follow over the weekend. Rob's tiny following is usually reserved for his closest family and friends, such as his sisters Kourtney, Khloe and Kim Kardashian. The reality star's unusual move came less than a week after he made a rare appearance on Keeping Up With The Kardashians to celebrate his daughter's birthday. But what do we know about Rob's new social media friend? Kenza Boutrif is a glamorous social media model that is represented by Wilhelmina Models. She boasts an impressive following of 634,000 fans on Instagram and only follows 103 back - including Rob. The well-travelled influencer boasts pictures taken in Dubai, New York and Los Angeles among her incredible collection of jet setting snaps and she was also at London Fashion Week earlier this year. Among her stellar collection of pictures, she has also received plenty of approval from other popular UK reality stars. Some of her pictures have been liked by Love Island stars Belle Hassan and Yewande Biala. Kenza also has her own Depop page where she is selling plenty of designer goods such as Comme Des Garcons and a pair of Alexander McQueen trainers. In the meantime, Rob is currently embroiled in a bitter fued with his ex-girlfriend and model Blac Chynna. The former couple dated back in 2016 and their daughter was born just one month before their split was made official. Since then, the volatile couple have been caught up in an ongoing and complicated custody battle over their Dream. At the end of February 2020, a judge denied Rob's request to have primary custody over his daughter. Both Rob and Kenza have been contacted for comment. Do you have a story to sell ? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 3303

Coronation Street’s Peter Barlow will save Yasmeen from jail and expose Geoff’s lies say fans

CORRIE fans think Peter Barlow will save Yasmeen Nazir from prison after he notices she’s been showing some worrying behaviour. It’s been a rollercoaster week on the cobbles as viewers have been left horrified by the abuse Yasmeen has experienced at the hands of her husband Geoff Metcalfe. Fans watched from behind their cushions as Yasmeen finally snapped after months of terrifying abuse and stabbed Geoff in the neck with a broken wine bottle. In spoilers for the long-running soap, it’s been revealed Yasmeen, played by Shelley King, will call the police be charged with attempted murder as street residents are left in shock at the news of the attack. But fans think Peter, played by Chris Gascoyne, will come to her rescue and tell police he’s witnessed several displays of worrying behaviour from her. One wrote: “…If you look in the last few episodes we had Sally, Eileen and Peter notice something wasn’t right but didn’t act. So maybe these are the people who will stick by Yasmeen.” And another added: “i really hope peter and eileen are going to be allies to yasmeen in the coming weeks bc they seem to be the only people to have suspicions about geoff” While a third guessed: “Calling for Peter being Yasmeen’s rescue…” Earlier in the episode fans were horrified as Yasmeen was dragged out to the pub in a red dress that charmless Geoff had originally bought for a sex worker. Geoff, played by Ian Bartholomew, took her to the Rovers to see Sally and Tim – before dropping the bombshell that he'd handed over her money to pay for their wedding. Yasmeen was shocked that he'd handed over a fortune without consulting her, but Geoff barked: "You want to do this now? Get your coat. Shift. Don't you dare turn the waterworks on in here." As she walked away from the bar the cameras lingered on Peter looking at her with concern, giving fans hope that he will realise something isn't adding up after Yasmeen's arrest Away from prying eyes at No.6 viewers watched in horror as Geoff grabbed a knife and told Yasmeen: "Maybe I should kill you – do the world a favour. Would anyone really notice if you were gone?" With that, she picked up a wine bottle and smashed abusive Geoff around the head before plunging the broken glass into his neck. Peter has been keeping an eye on Yasmeen ever since Geoff told everyone she had a drinking problem earlier this year. Fans are on the edge of their seats as they wait to see what happens, admitting they were “sucked in” by the plot. One wrote: “I love when #corrie does episodes like this. They are just so well put together and engaging. Proper sucked in by this storyline of poor Yasmeen and they're going a fantastic job of it.” Another added: “Lets go Yasmeen Thinking face Take that Geoff f**ker out preferably with a bullet bloody hard to watch #Corrie” And a third wrote: “It was very disturbing to watch but i am glad that Yasmeen has fought back. However she will not deserve to be sent to prison for this, i hope tim, sally , peter and her friends will understand what has been going on. Think Eileen does. No one shoud go through that. Awful man” We pay for videos too. Click here to upload yours.

3 May 20:20 • The Sun • https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11540145/coronation-streets-peter-barlow-save-yasmeen-jail-expose-geoff/
Rating: 2.72
Spoilers: Corrie boss reveals all on Yasmeen and Geoff ending

There have been some difficult decisions to be made throughout the long running storyline arc of Geoff Metcalfe’s (Ian Bartholomew) campaign of coercive abuse against Yasmeen Nazir (Shelley King), according to Coronation Street boss Iain Macleod – but one thing he insists is that the recent twist that saw the horrific husband left for dead was planned for the start. Viewers saw Geoff become more aggressive than ever and leave Yasmeen in terror of her life as he ranted horrific abuse and waved a knife in her face, suggesting it would be better for everyone if he just killed her. In a relexive move to defend herself, a petrified Yasmeen stabbed Geoff in the neck and will be seen phoning the police to reveal that she has killed her husband. It has been a deliberately slow paced story – and one that producer Iain admits has been the most debated over in the storyline office out of any plot. He told Radio Times: ‘It’s been refined month by month in conjunction with our charity and research partners (including Women’s Aid). We’ve known pretty much from the start this incident would be one of the major peaks. ‘It’s been organically told and we’ve agonised over the advancement of how Geoff’s behaviour evolved. ‘It has been discussed in more detail than any other story I’ve worked on, just to make sure we get the nuance right.’ The storyline has come up for almost universal praise, with many in Yasmeen’s position having commended the show for its accurate portrayal of coercive control. Iain added: ‘We don’t make it for this reason but it is important to have what I call good ‘drama karma’: what you’re putting on screen is karmically making the world little bit of a better place. I really think this story is.’ If you’ve got a soap or TV story, video or pictures get in touch by emailing us soaps@metro.co.uk – we’d love to hear from you. Join the community by leaving a comment below and stay updated on all things soaps at our homepage.

Louis Theroux slices finger off making Jamie Oliver pancake recipe – and he still can’t find it

LOUIS Theroux has managed to slice off part of his finger while trying his hand at making a pancake recipe by Jamie Oliver. The hit documentary maker has risked his life over the years to make great TV but it seems an encounter with a sharp knife and a red onion has inflicted the most trauma. Louis Theroux, 49, was trying his hand at a Jamie Oliver recipe for savoury pancakes on Saturday evening when the culinary catastrophe occurred. The BBC filmmaker shared a photo of his finger heavily bandaged up and a devastated expression on his face to his Instagram followers. In the caption Louis wrote: “Cut a small slice of my finger off while chopping a red onion for a Jamie Oliver recipe for carrot and coriander pancakes. “Briefly went pale and had to lie down. Family not impressed by my lack of stoicism. Me too frankly. Still haven’t found the missing piece of finger.” Celeb chef Jamie Oliver is yet to comment on the missing digit but Louis's other pals sent him comforting words, including fellow BBC presenter and former One Show host Matt Baker, who joked: “I think the recipe says Ginger not Finger.” Louis should be a dab hand in the kitchen after starring in BBC's Great Celebrity Bake Off where he had viewers in hysterics as he thrusted into the air during the Stand Up To Cancer special. The broadcaster was also the first to secure the coveted Paul Hollywood handshake, before Prue Leith followed suit. Louis then insisted comedian Noel Fielding shake his hand too, which Noel did so reluctantly, deadpanning: "This means nothing." We pay for videos too. Click here to upload yours.

3 May 22:30 • The Sun • https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11540574/louis-theroux-slices-finger-off-jamie-oliver-recipe/
Rating: 2.72
Louis Theroux ‘slices finger’ while trying Jamie Oliver pancake recipe

Louis Theroux risked it all while trying his hand at a Jamie Oliver recipe this weekend and ended up ‘slicing off’ part of his finger in the process. The BBC filmmaker got busy in the kitchen on Saturday night and decided to try one of Jamie’s quirky recipes for savoury pancakes.  However, it all ended in bloodshed with Louis, 49, sharing a photo of his poor finger bandaged up and a devastated expression on his face.  ‘Cut a small slice of my finger off while chopping a red onion for a Jamie Oliver recipe for carrot and coriander pancakes,’ Louis revealed to his Instagram followers.  ‘Briefly went pale and had to lie down. Family not impressed by my lack of stoicism. Me too frankly. Still haven’t found the missing piece of finger.’  While Jamie is yet to respond to Louis’ kitchen nightmare, the documentarian’s followers had plenty to say.  Former One Show host Matt Baker joked: ‘I think the recipe says Ginger not Finger.’  ‘That’s the universe’s way of saying you should stick with the lasagne,’ quipped another of Louis’ followers.  Keen to avoid the recipe themselves, one added: ‘Reasons why not to make carrot and coriander pancakes number 26.’  Another fan cried: ‘For Gods sake Louis, stop cooking!!!!’  It’s safe to say he’ll probably be ordering take out more often going forward.  Aside from creating a mess in the kitchen, Louis also opened up about his past interview with Tiger King’s Joe Exotic.  The pair met in 2011 for Louis’ BBC documentary America’s Most Dangerous Pets before Joe became the single most talked about man on the planet following the Netflix series.  ‘I knew him before he was famous,’ Louis said on The Graham Norton Show.  ‘I spent the best part of a week with him for a documentary on dangerous pets in 2011.’ ‘If I have any regrets, it’s not talking to him more about his two husbands and his rules of engagement for three-person love making!’ Got a showbiz story? If you’ve got a celebrity story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page – we’d love to hear from you.

3 May 11:52 • Metro • https://metro.co.uk/2020/05/03/louis-theroux-slices-finger-off-trying-jamie-oliver-recipe-pancakes-still-missing-12647895/

Antiques Roadshow sees James Bond hat valued at £30k

3 May 20:15 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.24
Importance: 1.24
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 20:01
Average US: 15.25
Weighted average US: 16.342819381051953
Average GB: 10.95
Weighted average GB: 17.418309309469652
Average IN: 7.7
Weighted average IN: 8.763283722104601

Antiques Roadshow sees James Bond hat valued at £30k

Antiques Roadshow shocked tonight as a James Bond bowler hat struck gold for a 007 fan with an impressive £30k valuation. The battered accessory, which used to deadly effect by infamous hitman Oddjob (played by Harold Sakata) in the 1964 film Goldfinger, was part of a collection of James Bond memorabilia brought to the show when it filmed at the National Botanic Garden of Wales last summer. Expert Marc Allum was seriously impressed by the treasures – including a number plate – and branded them as an ‘iconic part of Bond history.’ Looking at the items, Allum enthused: ‘I’m shaking with anticipation and excitement. This, I think, is an amazingly iconic collection of objects and an amazing story too.’ The owner admitted he was a huge fan of the franchise as a child and his brother-in-law, who was a driver for Aston Martin during the filming of Goldfinger, asked Pinewood Studios if they had any memorabilia. The studio gave him Oddjob’s bowler hat but insisted the metal rim was taken out before it was handed over – with disastrous consequences. ‘As a young lad, everybody wanted to throw the Oddjob hat, and if you look at it, everybody did throw the hat because it’s absolutely in pieces because it didn’t have the steel in it anymore, so therefore whenever it landed it damaged it,’ they said. Despite the damage, Marc valued the bowler hat between £20k-30k and the 007 number plate, which was used by Aston Martin to promote the film but never appeared on screen, at £4-6k. Although the owner of the collection said the items would be safely stowed away, he did express an interest in selling them. Over the years Antiques Roadshow has valued several James Bond items including a jacket worn by Daniel Craig in Casino Royale valued at £3-5k, a watch used in The World is Not Enough valued at £15-20k, and a first edition of The Man With The Golden Gun valued at £1.2-£1.5k. Antiques Roadshow airs tonight at 7.15pm on BBC One. Got a story? If you’ve got a celebrity story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page – we’d love to hear from you.

3 May 20:15 • Metro • https://metro.co.uk/2020/05/03/antiques-roadshow-james-bond-bowler-hat-goldfinger-12647813/
Rating: 2.18
Bond villain's hat goes up for auction on Antiques Roadshow for thousands

Oddjob’s deadly bowler hat in the 007 film ­Goldfinger has made a ­surprise appearance on the BBC’s Antiques Roadshow. The battered steel-rimmed hat was one of those thrown by actor and Olympic weightlifter Harold Sakata in the 1964 film, and valued at up to £30,000. It was part of a collection of James Bond memorabilia brought to the show when it filmed at the National Botanic Garden of Wales last summer. The hat, together with a 007 number plate, left Roadshow expert Marc Allum amazed. He called them an “iconic part of Bond history”, adding: “I’m shaking with excitement.” The owner said he was a huge 007 fan as a child and his brother-in-law was a driver for Aston Martin during the filming of Goldfinger, starring Sean Connery as Bond and Gert Frobe as the baddie. He asked for memorabilia and Pinewood Studios gave him Oddjob’s bowler hat but insisted the metal rim be taken out before it was handed over as it was too dangerous. He said: “As a young lad, everybody wanted to throw the Oddjob hat, and if you look at it, everybody did throw the hat because it’s absolutely in pieces because it didn’t have the steel in it any more, so therefore whenever it landed it damaged it.” Despite the damage, Marc valued the flat-crowned bowler at £20,000 to £30,000 and the 007 number plate, which was used by Aston Martin to promote the film but never appeared on screen, at £4,000 to £6,000. The owner of the collection said they would be stowed away, but he would be interested in selling them. Over the years, Antiques Roadshow has valued several James Bond items including a jacket worn by Daniel Craig in Casino Royale at £3,000-£5,000 and a watch used in The World is Not Enough valued at £15,000-£20,000.

3 May 20:01 • Irish Mirror • https://www.irishmirror.ie/tv/bond-villains-hat-goes-up-21968132

Casualty episode scrapped by BBC over Covid-19 - but fans want missing episode

Fans of medical drama Casualty want a missing episode made available on BBC iPlayer. The episode was due to be shown this weekend but was scrapped by the BBC due to 'inappropriate' content during the current coronavirus pandemic. An announcement before last night's instalment said: "The episode we were due to watch tonight, filmed before the spread of Covid-19, was considered inappropriate to show at the moment." The episode that aired on Saturday night instead included a short catch-up that filled viewers in on scenes from the major storylines that they will have missed due to the transmission of the preceding instalment being skipped. The announcer continued before it started: "But never fear. everything we need to know from that episode is in a catch up right at the start of the programme." However, the short recap before this weekend's episode wasn't enough for some fans, who have now taken to social media calling for the BBC to make the missing instalment available on their catch-up service, BBC iPlayer. One fan wrote on Twitter : "I assumed I’d missed one so checked iPlayer but no. Turns out the BBC decided to cut it! "Please put it on iPlayer so I can decide whether to watch it!!" Another disappointed viewer commented: "Can't they just put it on iplayer then? Gives people a choice on whether they want to watch or not! #casualty " Elsewhere, a third Casualty fan commented: "That missing episode of #Casualty looks great. Bonkers decision not to show it. "I understand the reasoning but I disagree with it." Another Twitter user thought the missing episode could have helped give some viewers a realistic look at what we're all currently facing. They tweeted: "Deemed inappropriate? Maybe show the episode and give people the reality check they need to keep them in the bloody house #casualty." Finally, one Casualty viewer concluded: "Hope they put the missing episode on iPlayer. "I get they didn't want to show it and the white suits on the preview suggest a virus situation but I still wanna watch it! We've missed a massive Marty storyline! #Casualty " Regardless of whether the BBC do eventually make the episode available to fans, Casualty will now be on a break until May 23 when it will return with its next episode. Casualty returns to BBC One later this month. What did you think of this weekend's Casualty episode? Let us know in the comments below.

Casualty viewers were confused last night when the BBC skipped an episode it called "inappropriate". Fans had been expecting to watch a gripping episode culminating with a showdown between Ethan and Will - but instead it was replaced by a catch-up and the following week's episode. A voiceover announcer said: "The episode we were due to watch tonight, filmed before the spread of COVID-19, was considered inappropriate to show at the moment. "But never fear, everything we need to know from that episode is in a catch-up right at the start of the programme." Read more: EastEnders viewers want Nancy Carter to return as Casualty confirms actress Maddy Hill's exit However glimpses of the episode from the preview showed characters dressed in full protective gear, suggesting an epidemic style storyline. Such a plot would too closely mirror real life events with the current pandemic. But that didn't stop fans being confused about what was going on. And they were still desperate to see the missing episode. One said: "Really, really disappointed at the missing episode of #Casualty, especially when it’s so pivotal to current storylines. Read more: EastEnders, Casualty and Holby City are 'not quite' ready to resume production "There are ways of cheating, actors being close enough together to interact in a scene." He added: "We’re not quite at that point yet. "But all of those conversation are being had and there is a real determination to get that show back up and running." Romeo Beckham, 17, celebrates first anniversary with girlfriend despite lockdown

The 17-year-old son of David and Victoria Beckham is currently separated from his girlfriend due to the coronavirus pandemic. Romeo is currently staying with his parents and younger siblings, Cruz Beckham and Harper Seven Beckham. The family celebrated patriarch David's 45th birthday on Saturday with some rather cute tributes, but now Romeo has his own milestone to mark. The lad posted a selection of throwback snaps with Mia, who is also known by Mimi Moocher. The pics came with the caption: "Happy 1 year mooch love u so much @mimimoocher." Romeo has previously shared an insight into the pair's Valentine's Day trip to Paris earlier this year. The pair posed for a mirror selfie together and visited the legendary Louvre museum. Rumours of a romance between Romeo and his lady-love were seemingly confirmed when Mimi attended a private family dinner with Romeo to celebrate Victoria's Fashion Week show. Meanwhile, Romeo isn't the only Beckham kid to be loved-up. Older brother Brooklyn Beckham, 21, is currently residing in the US with his actress girlfriend, Nicola Peltz. Unlike Romeo, Brooklyn is separated from his family as he remains in lockdown with his partner. That didn't stop Brooklyn from sending dad David his own sweet birthday message on Saturday, however. Romeo Beckham celebrates first anniversary with girlfriend Mia Regan

Romeo Beckham is clearly a charmer like his father as he showered his girlfriend, Mia Regan, with all the love in celebration of their first anniversary this weekend.  The 17-year-old was feeling very sentimental as he shared cute photos of them together from the past year and it seems the honeymoon phase isn’t over just yet.  ‘Happy 1 year mooch love u so much,’ Romeo captioned the Instagram post.  Romeo’s aunt and David Beckham’s sister Joanne had all the feels over Romeo’s sweet sentiments and commented: ‘Oh my god this is the cutest ever 😍 happy one year guys ❤️.’  Although they’re celebrating their one-year anniversary now, the young lovebirds were only linked back in September 2019 when Mia was spotted with Romeo at his mum Victoria Beckham’s London Fashion Week showcase. They kept it lowkey during the runway show but were spotted sitting together during the family dinner at Harry’s Bar in Mayfair later that evening.  In November 2019, Megan then wished Romeo a happy birthday on Instagram to which he replied: ‘Happy b day Mooch. Hope you have a lovely day xxxx p.s. loving the glasses,’ making their relationship Instagram official.  Since then, it’s been a whirlwind romance for Megan and Romeo, who whisked the model off to Paris – the city of love – for a romantic weekend in December. They took in all the sights, including the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe, while also hanging out with friends.  Mia also joined Romeo and his family as his dad David launched his new football team Inter Miami CF in March.  At the moment though, the couple appear to be separated by the coronavirus lockdown with Romeo self-isolating with his parents Victoria and David, and siblings Cruz and Harper in the UK, while older brother Brooklyn remains in the US with his girlfriend Nicola Peltz. The family enjoyed even more celebrations as retired footballer David celebrated his 45th birthday.  Romeo posted a celebratory message to his old man, which read: ‘Happy birthday dad I love you so so so so much and hope you have the best day ♥️sorry for being officially taller than you now.’  David quipped back: ‘It’s all because the ManBun.’  Got a showbiz story?
